commit_message:
Fix member operating status when add/remove HM

This patch makes sure we consistently update the member operating status
when the user adds/removes a health monitor from a pool.

Change-Id: I71184d66ee035b9afbfee62e9a0ebb5147c2b47e

commit_message:
look for patches on origin/master or master

When the branch for the series does not exist, look on 'origin/master'
as well as 'master' because depending on how the repo is cloned we
might not have a branch called 'master'.

Change-Id: I6abc0b0b3a1657211a01b80547602bbbe83f065e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add RemoveNetwork command to server

This command will detach a server from a network. All server's
neutron ports that belongs to the specified networks will be removed.

Change-Id: I83a064ed62ab00c6f1016900b9cf30f1c15b8382

messages: [{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2017-11-08 11:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2017-11-08 12:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nLike for the stable/pike backport this is a small patch, self-contained to the one command which doesn't work at all without it. I tested this against an Ocata cloud both to confirm that the problem reproduces there, and that this patch resolves it."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-12 01:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 11:59:39.000000000', 'message': "Neutron agent delete: remove the wrong argument

The take_action() function was calling get_agent() with the wrong
attribute, causing agent deletion to fail. It turns out calling
get_agent() isn't necessary; this removes the call entirely and moves
the 'ignore_missing' argument to the delete_agent() function.

Change-Id: Iaa3754a3be0765112f396495fa5fb2e32e6eae4e
Closes-Bug: #1711301
(cherry picked from commit 6c8e5177bc54ba215aad310094b1eefd6ce709cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron agent delete: remove the wrong argument

The take_action() function was calling get_agent() with the wrong
attribute, causing agent deletion to fail. It turns out calling
get_agent() isn't necessary; this removes the call entirely and moves
the 'ignore_missing' argument to the delete_agent() function.

Change-Id: Iaa3754a3be0765112f396495fa5fb2e32e6eae4e
Closes-Bug: #1711301
(cherry picked from commit 6c8e5177bc54ba215aad310094b1eefd6ce709cf)

commit_message:
Neutron agent delete: remove the wrong argument

The take_action() function was calling get_agent() with the wrong
attribute, causing agent deletion to fail. It turns out calling
get_agent() isn't necessary; this removes the call entirely and moves
the 'ignore_missing' argument to the delete_agent() function.

Change-Id: Iaa3754a3be0765112f396495fa5fb2e32e6eae4e
Closes-Bug: #1711301
(cherry picked from commit 6c8e5177bc54ba215aad310094b1eefd6ce709cf)

commit_message:
Tests for DNS integration

Add test coverage for the integration with designate, confirming that
the correct DNS records are generated for

- floating IP created with dns_(domain|name) attributes
- instances that are assigned a floating IP

Change-Id: I5a3fb7ae702cf06fbb8e7e3fb2a143bada05836d

update the master tempest skip list, remove old bugs

The master skip list is full of old tempest bugs.
Bugs have been checked for closure or being stale
e.g. 1+ year no action.

(9 comments)

Really sorry for late.

Currently --advertise-xxxx option take a boolean True/False argument, but OSC convention uses a pair of --advertise-xxxx and --no-advertise-xxxx. This is the only thing I think it is better to fix.

If you don't mind changing options soon, I am okay to merge this and update them in a follow-up patch (before cutting a neutronclient release). I am okay with either way, so I push no score at the moment and would like to wait a response from the author."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-10-24 08:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38:

commit_message:
Dynamic routing CLIs OSC transition

Neutron is transitioning its CLI to OSC, should update dynamic routing
CLIs to align with OSC plugin.

Change-Id: Ic1a633ca103d9e97e28ddf23e0f528e0261ce497
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan@6tidwells.com>
Co-Authored-By: Roey Chen <roeyc@vmware.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-spinout
Partial-Bug: #1560003

commit_message:
HAproxy should get full response from ironic-inspector

Ironic-inspector spams the logs with errors if we don't get full
response. If ironic-inspector answers something with 200 it should
be fine.

Change-Id: I464cdd139fb93ce7cd19fc5ac5960f302ae1a9f4
Closes-Bug: #1691971
Resolves: rhbz#1477663
(cherry picked from commit 93ae3c95955e0c66550d3cf50f3d1b8715a935e5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 04:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'OVN: Provide the option to define NeutronBridgeMappings as a role parameter

In order for a node to provide external connectivity to tenant traffic,
ovn-bridge-mappings should be defined which is read by ovn-controller service.
This value comes the T-H-T param 'NeutronBridgeMappings'. Presently
this param is defined with the default value "datacentre:br-ex" and is configured
on every node where ovn-controller service is enabled. This would cause problems
if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
'}, {'created': '2017-11-08 04:03:12.000000000', 'message': 'OVN: Provide the option to define NeutronBridgeMappings as a role parameter

In order for a node to provide external connectivity to tenant traffic,
ovn-bridge-mappings should be defined which is read by ovn-controller service.
This value comes the T-H-T param 'NeutronBridgeMappings'. Presently
this param is defined with the default value "datacentre:br-ex" and is configured
on every node where ovn-controller service is enabled. This would cause problems
if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
Closes-bug: #1730711
'}, {'created': '2017-11-08 09:57:40.000000000', 'message': 'OVN: Provide the option to define NeutronBridgeMappings as a role parameter

In order for a node to provide external connectivity to tenant traffic,
ovn-bridge-mappings should be defined which is read by ovn-controller service.
This value comes from the T-H-T param 'NeutronBridgeMappings'. Presently
this param is defined with the default value "datacentre:br-ex" and is configured
on every node where ovn-controller service is enabled. This would cause problems
if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
Closes-bug: #1730711
'}, {'created': '2017-11-08 11:43:51.000000000', 'message': 'OVN: Provide the option to define NeutronBridgeMappings as a role parameter

In order for a node to provide external connectivity to tenant traffic,
ovn-bridge-mappings should be defined which is read by ovn-controller service.
This value comes from the T-H-T param 'NeutronBridgeMappings'. Presently
this param is defined with the default value "datacentre:br-ex" and is configured
on every node where ovn-controller service is enabled. This would cause problems
if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Since NeutronBridgeMappings is also used by neutron-ovs-agent service, this patch
also modifies puppet/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml to define NeutronBridgeMappings
as a role parameter.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
Closes-bug: #1730711

if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Since NeutronBridgeMappings is also used by neutron-ovs-agent service, this patch
also modifies puppet/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml to define NeutronBridgeMappings
as a role parameter.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
Closes-bug: #1730711

commit_message:
OVN: Provide the option to define NeutronBridgeMappings as a role parameter

In order for a node to provide external connectivity to tenant traffic,
ovn-bridge-mappings should be defined which is read by ovn-controller service.
This value comes from the T-H-T param 'NeutronBridgeMappings'. Presently
this param is defined with the default value "datacentre:br-ex" and is configured
on every node where ovn-controller service is enabled. This would cause problems
if some of the hosts do not provide external connectvity.

To solve this problem, this patch adds 'NeutronBridgeMappings' as a role parameter
so that it can set to empty string if the role doesn't provide external connectivity.

In the OVN environment template files, this param is set to empty for Compute role.

Since NeutronBridgeMappings is also used by neutron-ovs-agent service, this patch
also modifies puppet/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml to define NeutronBridgeMappings
as a role parameter.

Change-Id: I6a00b8dc1ff387cc5e1e62b4d9d7da5e1239ee31
Closes-bug: #1730711

commit_message:
Fix panko ssl port

Panko ssl port should be 13977 as defined in puppet tripleo
haproxy resource. Due to this we have a mismatch
and undercloud events fail to work.

Closes-bug: #1732459

Change-Id: I7d01af154cc9e13a30107e810cbaf951fb751f1c
(cherry picked from commit 96df8b12409e8e71e41fc4150306eb7ac579227e)

commit_message:
Add rsyslog sidecar image for container image prepare

Some services (namely HAProxy and swift) use syslog for their logging,
and will need a sidecar container that runs rsyslog to redirect the logs
to stdout. So, when these services are enabled and we set the variable
"logging" to "stdout", we then enable the rsyslog container image as a
parameter.

The rsyslog-base image was used since we don't need any plugins for the
sidecar container.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: I1bb6db4a80c601790800a6d5657c9f114d0d8e74

commit_message:
Move defaults out of overcloud_containers.yaml.j2

This change moves the image prepare defaults out of
overcloud_containers.yaml.j2 and into python in kolla_builder. This
has been done for two reasons:

- The jinja template now has hyphen appending/prepending logic. Doing
  this in python allows unit testing
- The image prepare CLI arguments should have defaults populated from
  a single common location. Moving them out of the template allows that.

Change-Id: Ib657fa052074aff28390cd2902b56672f8b236b1
Partial-Bug: #1727519

commit_message:
Install ansible-pacemaker during the upgrade/update in the UC

With a Pike undercloud, we might not have ansible-pacemaker
installed on the undercloud.
We need to make sure that ansible-pacemaker is installed for
minor update and later for major upgrade

Closes-Bug: #1732354

Change-Id: I30ed7bcbe4c342a2174f25d62ec85b39ae3317c0

commit_message:
Add TLS for ec2api service

This adds a TLS proxy in front of it so it serves TLS in the
internal network.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I24d990eccf7affd5f3899338ac96d02d2d47460e
(cherry picked from commit 24a3e20eeda2efad0a6d61927ab0848bc8b625a8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 11:47:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix variable user's definition in unittest code

In unittest code before, actual result of user.databases
is ['d', 'b', '3'], not ['db1', 'db2', 'db3'], length
of list is also 3 so test passed. Fix the definition of
variable 'user' to ensure expected result

Change-Id: I2cb41ec0bcd8d9ae1c075880cff0edb23beda351
"}]
commit_message:
Fix variable user's definition in unittest code

In unittest code before, actual result of user.databases
is ['d', 'b', '3'], not ['db1', 'db2', 'db3'], length
of list is also 3 so test passed. Fix the definition of
variable 'user' to ensure expected result

Change-Id: I2cb41ec0bcd8d9ae1c075880cff0edb23beda351

[{'created': '2017-10-31 17:56:25.000000000', 'message': 'IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION Wrongly Templated As String

In the template file horizon_local_settings.py.j2, the
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION value is being set as a string, when it should
be a bool.

Change-Id: I6589fe93abab76243d30136babaa7b1e95989243
Closes-Bug: 1727438
(cherry picked from commit 941398b22cb2f5be9eaa4131e876b10921b8e5b2)
'}]
commit_message:
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION Wrongly Templated As String

In the template file horizon_local_settings.py.j2, the
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION value is being set as a string, when it should
be a bool.

Change-Id: I6589fe93abab76243d30136babaa7b1e95989243
Closes-Bug: 1727438
(cherry picked from commit 941398b22cb2f5be9eaa4131e876b10921b8e5b2)

commit_message:
Add allocation pool for octavia mgmt subnet

octavia_management_net_subnet_allocation_pools: "start_ip-end_ip"
ex: octavia_management_net_subnet_allocation_pools: "100.66.8.51-100.66.9.254"
default value to ""

Change-Id: I635c19cd68a194bcbbb33619f9c683c5022894f4
(cherry picked from commit e1440d628507fb8a14221ff340351672ae4ebf5f)

Fix syntax error with when statement for build-wheel-mirror

Doesn't look like --syntax-check or linters caught this.  Update to be
more correct.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

- gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/06/509306/3/check/gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/2f11328/ : SUCCESS in 19m 08s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-10-06 16:48:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I like this new API, I think this is almost definitely the correct path forward, nice work tim

I'm trying to brainstorm if there's another qs that would be more descriptive than heartbeat, maybe async_status=true? We might ask in the next upstream meeting or on the ML?  Or maybe ask Joel or anyone in addition to yourself that's spent a good amount of time thinking about swift client api access?  I'm happy enough with heartbeat... but I've been accused of having very weak sense of ascetic.  I don't see any *inconsistency* in using heartbeat=on other than some API's behave this way already by default...

new client facing api should have a func test

it sucks that we document the large object api in two places - i see two ways forward:

1) make a pre-req change that somehow consolidate the documentation for the client facing API of large objects into a single place [1] - then this change would update that *one* place

2) update both places [2], so that this change is complete and leave the orthogonal work of consolidating documentation for future work

1. maybe we can just drop one, or have them pull from the same single source of truth?
2. i.e. put something in doc/source/api/large_objects.rst too"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-06 20:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-17 22:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-10-18 01:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(8 comments)

i uploaded a big 'ol object with bunches of segments:

    swift upload test big.obj -S 1500 --use-slo

Then I grabbed the raw manifest:

   curl -H 'x-auth-token: <token>' "http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/test/big.obj?multipart-manifest=get&format=raw" > manifest.json

... and double checked my json:

    cat manifest.json | python -m json.tool

I had ~700 segments

I rewrote my object-servers to sleep for 1 on HEAD

    diff --git a/swift/obj/server.py b/swift/obj/server.py
    index 563ccb9..8529ca5 100644
    --- a/swift/obj/server.py
    +++ b/swift/obj/server.py
    @@ -1151,7 +1151,7 @@ class ObjectController(BaseStorageServer):
                     self.logger.debug(log_line)
                 else:
                     self.logger.info(log_line)
    -        if req.method in ('PUT', 'DELETE'):
    +        if req.method in ('PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD'):
                 slow = self.slow - trans_time
                 if slow > 0:
                     sleep(slow)

^ with slow = 1 in the conf

Then I uploaded the object (with no buffering from cURL):

    curl -H 'x-auth-token: <token>' "http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/test/big.obj?multipart-manifest=put&heartbeat=on" -XPUT -T manifest.json -v -N

... and it printed a bunch of cute little spaces!

Then like after... idk 5 mins?

    Etag: "c2d52e19dd0b99ce4c96ea0098d6323f"
    Response Body: 
    Response Status: 201 Created
    Errors:

I don't love heartbeat=on - it's not obvious to me why a client author would immediately think they wanted heartbeat if they didn't understand the original problem... idk, it's probably fine, i'm probably just sour we can't change the default behavior.

I tried xml responses, they look like this:

    <delete>
    <etag>"c2d52e19dd0b99ce4c96ea0098d6323f"</etag>
    <response_body></response_body>
    <response_status>201 Created</response_status>
    <errors>
    </errors>
    </delete>

Is that *correct*?  who knows... </delete>???  I commented out the bit about xml over in bulk that handles xml and all the unittests for slo still pass... w/e #xmlisforsuckers!'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 17:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Yeah, that <delete> tag is hard-coded in get_response_body: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.15.1/swift/common/middleware/bulk.py#L234

...which handle_extract_iter totally uses: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.15.1/swift/common/middleware/bulk.py#L641

*sigh*'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 19:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 21:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-10-24 18:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(8 comments)

@Tim this is as far as I got today'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-24 19:07:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(8 comments)

This is awesome Tim. works well when I forced a slowdown to watch the heartbeat in action. Caused errors and problem segments where reported.

Only problem I have is 'yield_frequency' although sounds great, tho without the notes doesn't really explain what it does. IMHO 'heartbeat_frequency' would be better, even if it doesn't sound as good as yield :)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-30 17:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-03 22:43:50.000000000', 'message': 'Let clients request heartbeats during SLO PUTs

An SLO PUT requires that we HEAD every referenced object; as a result, it
can be a very time-intensive operation. This makes it difficult as a
client to differentiate between a proxy-server that's still doing work and
one that's crashed but left the socket open.

Now, clients can opt-in to receiving heartbeats during long-running PUTs
by including the query parameter

    heartbeat=on

With heartbeating turned on, the proxy will attempt to complete the
request within some configurable amount of time, defaulting to 10
seconds. If this is possible, the response will be sent directly.

If the request takes longer to complete, the proxy will respond with
202 Accepted then send a single whitespace character periodically until
the request completes. At that point, a final summary chunk will be sent
which includes a "Response Status" key indicating success or failure and
(if successful) an "Etag" key indicating the Etag of the resulting SLO.

This mechanism is very similar to the way bulk extractions and deletions
work, and even the way SLO behaves for ?multipart-manifest=delete requests.

Note that this is opt-in: this prevents us from sending the 202 response
to existing clients that may mis-interpret it as an immediate indication
of success.

Related-Bug: 1718811
Change-Id: I65cee5f629c87364e188aa05a06d563c3849c8f3

'}, {'created': '2017-11-03 03:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Let clients request heartbeats during SLO PUTs

An SLO PUT requires that we HEAD every referenced object; as a result, it
can be a very time-intensive operation. This makes it difficult as a
client to differentiate between a proxy-server that's still doing work and
one that's crashed but left the socket open.

Now, clients can opt-in to receiving heartbeats during long-running PUTs
by including the query parameter

    heartbeat=on

With heartbeating turned on, the proxy will attempt to complete the
request within some configurable amount of time, defaulting to 10
seconds. If this is possible, the response will be sent directly.

If the request takes longer to complete, the proxy will respond with
202 Accepted then send a single whitespace character periodically until
the request completes. At that point, a final summary chunk will be sent
which includes a "Response Status" key indicating success or failure and
(if successful) an "Etag" key indicating the Etag of the resulting SLO.

This mechanism is very similar to the way bulk extractions and deletions
work, and even the way SLO behaves for ?multipart-manifest=delete requests.

Note that this is opt-in: this prevents us from sending the 202 response
to existing clients that may mis-interpret it as an immediate indication
of success.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: 1718811

commit_message:
Let clients request heartbeats during SLO PUTs

An SLO PUT requires that we HEAD every referenced object; as a result, it
can be a very time-intensive operation. This makes it difficult as a
client to differentiate between a proxy-server that's still doing work and
one that's crashed but left the socket open.

Now, clients can opt-in to receiving heartbeats during long-running PUTs
by including the query parameter

    heartbeat=on

With heartbeating turned on, the proxy will start its response immediately
with 202 Accepted then send a single whitespace character periodically
until the request completes. At that point, a final summary chunk will be
sent which includes a "Response Status" key indicating success or failure
and (if successful) an "Etag" key indicating the Etag of the resulting SLO.

This mechanism is very similar to the way bulk extractions and deletions
work, and even the way SLO behaves for ?multipart-manifest=delete requests.

Note that this is opt-in: this prevents us from sending the 202 response
to existing clients that may mis-interpret it as an immediate indication
of success.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: 1718811
Change-Id: I65cee5f629c87364e188aa05a06d563c3849c8f3

commit_message:
For Python 3 Common patterns-six string

Replace basestring with six.string_types and add a hacking rule
to check it. This modification refers to neutron and merge
translation_checks into checks .Follow-up will modify the other
on the python3 common

subject: Fix Devstack plugin
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 17:16:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Devstack plugin

When using mod-wsgi with devstack, apache is configured and restarted just
after cloudkitty-processor is started, causing a ConnexionRefused error when
ck-proc tries to authenticate against keystone and making the devstack fail.
This adds a sleep to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I080a364be2f783610252a40dc70f2eb5babd1467
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Devstack plugin

When using mod-wsgi with devstack, apache is configured and restarted just
after cloudkitty-processor is started, causing a ConnexionRefused error when
ck-proc tries to authenticate against keystone and making the devstack fail.
This adds a sleep to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I080a364be2f783610252a40dc70f2eb5babd1467

[{'created': '2017-11-15 19:25:48.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait on TRY_AGAIN when calling commit_block()

commit_block() calls idl.run() already, so the seqno has already
changed, and waiting again could potentially wait until a timeout
occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I1e5f4627f0488ba15ba2fb3509504bcf1b787b07
(cherry picked from commit 611c79b82d9780418dcea9fd55dc511f1cd52b55)
"}, {'created': '2017-11-15 19:55:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait on TRY_AGAIN when calling commit_block()

commit_block() calls idl.run() already, so the seqno has already
changed, and waiting again could potentially wait until a timeout
occurs. From the ovs.db.idl docs:

 If the final status is Transaction.TRY_AGAIN, wait for
 Idl.change_seqno to change from the saved 'seqno' (it's possible
 that it's already changed, in which case the client should not
 wait at all), then start over from step 1.  Only a call to
 Idl.run() will change the return value of Idl.change_seqno.
 (Transaction.commit_block() calls Idl.run().)

Closes-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I1e5f4627f0488ba15ba2fb3509504bcf1b787b07
(cherry picked from commit 158ae06bce0f56e93677f94c59f81e5e76ee1ccc)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't wait on TRY_AGAIN when calling commit_block()

commit_block() calls idl.run() already, so the seqno has already
changed, and waiting again could potentially wait until a timeout
occurs. From the ovs.db.idl docs:

 If the final status is Transaction.TRY_AGAIN, wait for
 Idl.change_seqno to change from the saved 'seqno' (it's possible
 that it's already changed, in which case the client should not
 wait at all), then start over from step 1.  Only a call to
 Idl.run() will change the return value of Idl.change_seqno.
 (Transaction.commit_block() calls Idl.run().)

Closes-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I1e5f4627f0488ba15ba2fb3509504bcf1b787b07
(cherry picked from commit 158ae06bce0f56e93677f94c59f81e5e76ee1ccc)

commit_message:
Don't wait on TRY_AGAIN when calling commit_block()

commit_block() calls idl.run() already, so the seqno has already
changed, and waiting again could potentially wait until a timeout
occurs. From the ovs.db.idl docs:

 If the final status is Transaction.TRY_AGAIN, wait for
 Idl.change_seqno to change from the saved 'seqno' (it's possible
 that it's already changed, in which case the client should not
 wait at all), then start over from step 1.  Only a call to
 Idl.run() will change the return value of Idl.change_seqno.
 (Transaction.commit_block() calls Idl.run().)

Closes-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I1e5f4627f0488ba15ba2fb3509504bcf1b787b07

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

subject: Make xml responses less insane
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 19:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 19:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2017-10-19 20:45:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm okay with this, because
 - compatibility hazard seems small; if something was not quoted before, it was invalid; if someone calls get_response_body from out the tree and fails on the extra argument, he knew the risks
 - XML declaration is optional; okay to continue starting with root tag"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 20:51:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We still have the XML declaration for bulk -- that's the responsibility of whoever's calling get_response_body:

- https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.15.1/swift/common/middleware/bulk.py#L386
- https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.15.1/swift/common/middleware/bulk.py#L514

SLO never had it, no change there."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-19 21:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-10-31 03:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Missed adding root_tag as a param, but otherwise looks much better. The delete tags are crazy. I just hope users out there don't have tools to parse XML of extracting bulk or slo puts that assume a delete."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-31 18:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-31 18:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-10-31 22:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Tim. Now we're getting a docs build error, when I build I get a different one. So that's awesome. I wonder if mine is due to my saio env.

The  gerrit one, doesn't seem to like the indentation on the new param. So want to recreate the problem before I just hit recheck."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-11-01 03:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2017-11-01 15:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(verified that it's just the :param: since my +2)"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-11-02 02:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

less insane is always better :)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 19:14:21.000000000', 'message': 'Make xml responses less insane

Looking at bulk extractions:

   $ tar c *.py | curl http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/c?extract-archive=tar \
      -H accept:application/xml -T -
   <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
   <delete>
   <number_files_created>2</number_files_created>
   <response_body></response_body>
   <response_status>201 Created</response_status>
   <errors>
   </errors>
   </delete>

Or SLO upload failures:

   $ curl http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/c/slo?multipart-manifest=put -X PUT \
      -d '[{"path": "not/found"}]' -H accept:application/xml
   <delete>
   <errors>
   <object><name>not/found</name><status>404 Not Found</status></object></errors>
   </delete>

Why <delete>? Makes no sense.

Drive-by: stop being so quadratic.

Change-Id: I46b233864ba2815ac632d856b9f3c40cc9d0001a

commit_message:
Make xml responses less insane

Looking at bulk extractions:

   $ tar c *.py | curl http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/c?extract-archive=tar \
      -H accept:application/xml -T -
   <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
   <delete>
   <number_files_created>2</number_files_created>
   <response_body></response_body>
   <response_status>201 Created</response_status>
   <errors>
   </errors>
   </delete>

Or SLO upload failures:

   $ curl http://saio:8090/v1/AUTH_test/c/slo?multipart-manifest=put -X PUT \
      -d '[{"path": "not/found"}]' -H accept:application/xml
   <delete>
   <errors>
   <object><name>not/found</name><status>404 Not Found</status></object></errors>
   </delete>

Why <delete>? Makes no sense.

Drive-by: stop being so quadratic.

Change-Id: I46b233864ba2815ac632d856b9f3c40cc9d0001a

commit_message:
Install parallel from EPEL for build-wheel-mirror

Right now, it seems we only need parallel from EPEL. Rather then
enabling the whole repo, we can just opt to install it first, then
bindep will be happy.

Change-Id: Ifd1eb186f78c395f549d1430cfe4414ac1121f63
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-05 15:56:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove metadata/system_metadata filter handling from get_all

Since change I7141eef6a1c85ec6d6e8ee170911572535652978
this is dead code - the REST API handler code will check
to see if the user is trying to filter on joined tables
and return a 400 response, so we'd never get here now.

Change-Id: I75438ffb6cabf797aa98a93963107139a68e20b3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove metadata/system_metadata filter handling from get_all

Since change I7141eef6a1c85ec6d6e8ee170911572535652978
this is dead code - the REST API handler code will check
to see if the user is trying to filter on joined tables
and return a 400 response, so we'd never get here now.

Change-Id: I75438ffb6cabf797aa98a93963107139a68e20b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 21:47:58.000000000', 'message': "use net mtu api def from neutron-lib

The net mtu extension's API definition was moved into neutron-lib with
commit I41d5b399a6bd02f89f2e60c5ccb3fc0944b61255
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the parent class of the extension.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I0bc7ba5e1e267183e9b440bedcdbe373e635297e
"}]
commit_message:
use net mtu api def from neutron-lib

The net mtu extension's API definition was moved into neutron-lib with
commit I41d5b399a6bd02f89f2e60c5ccb3fc0944b61255
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the parent class of the extension.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I0bc7ba5e1e267183e9b440bedcdbe373e635297e

commit_message:
Add functionality to deprecate policies

This patch adds the ability to invoke deprecation messages when
certain policies are used. This gives developers a way to communicate
changing policies to operators in a programmable way.

bp policy-deprecation

Change-Id: I6348299970a1be502909f698a432b3bcaf6b9c8b

commit_message:
update bindep list

Add a bindep.txt file so CI does not use the defaults and we are
explicit about the python-dev dependency.

Add a note to the manual installation instructions explaining the need
for the Python source headers.

Change-Id: Ida4b897da4bdc3284a131166fdfa17bc9a4b1abd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix yaql / json_pp deprecation warning

By default deprecationwarnings only trigger once per invocation,
so this test dependent strongly on execution order of all the tests
to pass. by enforcing warnings to be enabled while recording for
deprecationwarnings we can make this more reliable.

Change-Id: I657786b8c73488203f8b056adc65df77e084ec85

* Added a method called via scheduler to check and fix workflow
  execution integrity. Specifically, this method finds all
  task executions in RUNNING state and for each of them checks
  whether all its action/workflow executions are finished. If yes,
  it most likely means that the task got stuck (i.e. an RPC
  was lost) and we need to repair it.

commit_message:
Add a periodic job to check workflow execution integrity

* Added a method called via scheduler to check and fix workflow
  execution integrity. Specifically, this method finds all
  task executions in RUNNING state and for each of them checks
  whether all its action/workflow executions are finished. If yes,
  it most likely means that the task got stuck (i.e. an RPC
  was lost) and we need to repair it.
* Also added atomic update of a task execution state using the
  well-known approach with "UPDATE ... WHERE" SQL query which
  returns a number of actually updated rows. This prevents
  from possible races between concurrent processes that try to
  update a task execution in overlapping transactions.
* Other minor style changes

Change-Id: If4f2efb05d959d1ffdb16515f08a811c5ce597e6

commit_message:
Improve swift testing and add swiftinit

There are a few items missing at the moment which are not
being tested in p-o-i.  This adds them as well as the support
to be able to test Swift with it.

Change-Id: I0bc2cfa87f6db9b46087c8ba6f6df62268e4336e

fix tag filtering logic

The check for missing tags was continuing the inner loop instead of
the loop over deliverables.

commit_message:
Fix regression for list_router_interfaces

A filter for router ports was introduced in [1] that only works when
Neutron DVR and HA are disabled. We need different filter values in the
DVR or HA case.

[1] I7fb5add36af09cc22084c8c034bf9f3cd0fbb442

Change-Id: I0253ecc6411426e554c08010186c72394a318268
Story: 2001265
Task: 5799

subject: Handle glance image pagination links better
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-07 00:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-07 22:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-10 14:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-11 12:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-15 05:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-15 05:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:49:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nself-approving. This is a 'backported' patch already landed in shade."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 00:04:34.000000000', 'message': 'Handle glance image pagination links better

Glance returns pagination links like "/v2/images?marker=". keystoneauth
Adapter treats absolute links like that as if they are rooted on the
service url. Since the catalog has https://image.example.com/v2 in it,
the Adapter will be mounted on that, which means /v2/images will be
treated as "https://image.example.com/v2/v2/iamges - which is not
correct.

Doing a urljoin would also be incorrect in an OpenStack context, because
the service could be on a sub-url, such as https://example.com/image,
meaning the v2 API endpoint would be https://example.com/image/v2 -
which means a straight urljoin of https://example.com/image/v2 and
/v2/images?marker= would result in https://example.com/v2/images?marker=
which is wrong since it strips the /image path prefix.

The most correct things for glance to do would be to return a full
absolute url - or a full relative URL. Constructing the absolute url
shade-side is hard for the above reasons - we don't have the right
context.

Strip /v1/ or /v2/ from the front of the next links (yay!) to turn
it into a relative url - thereby letting adapter.get(endpoint) do the
correct thing.

While doing this, update the catalog fixture in the test suite to have a
trailing /v2 so that we can be sure we're doing the correct thing in our
unit tests. Also add suburl fixtures to ensure that we work with
suburls.

Change-Id: I6fc8484ed62a029a8ba8ff1d31a37ba69e3000cf

commit_message:
Handle glance image pagination links better

Glance returns pagination links like "/v2/images?marker=". keystoneauth
Adapter treats absolute links like that as if they are rooted on the
service url. Since the catalog has https://image.example.com/v2 in it,
the Adapter will be mounted on that, which means /v2/images will be
treated as "https://image.example.com/v2/v2/iamges - which is not
correct.

Doing a urljoin would also be incorrect in an OpenStack context, because
the service could be on a sub-url, such as https://example.com/image,
meaning the v2 API endpoint would be https://example.com/image/v2 -
which means a straight urljoin of https://example.com/image/v2 and
/v2/images?marker= would result in https://example.com/v2/images?marker=
which is wrong since it strips the /image path prefix.

The most correct things for glance to do would be to return a full
absolute url - or a full relative URL. Constructing the absolute url
shade-side is hard for the above reasons - we don't have the right
context.

Strip /v1/ or /v2/ from the front of the next links (yay!) to turn
it into a relative url - thereby letting adapter.get(endpoint) do the
correct thing.

While doing this, update the catalog fixture in the test suite to have a
trailing /v2 so that we can be sure we're doing the correct thing in our
unit tests. Also add suburl fixtures to ensure that we work with
suburls.

Change-Id: I6fc8484ed62a029a8ba8ff1d31a37ba69e3000cf

commit_message:
Fix magnum functional test

A previous patch got a little greedy with a global search and replace.
However, while we're in there, use TempDir fixture rather than a static
path in /tmp.

Change-Id: Icd05c5435bd283e1deda80e65ea34289f6351a0e

subject: use flavors api def from neutron-lib
messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-11-14 18:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-11-14 18:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 18:01:12.000000000', 'message': "use flavors api def from neutron-lib

The flavors extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit I0229a80bb168bac8dc0fa17fb2b06f1b140d27b4 and will be consumed in
neutron with I265ac1c0596d0fb0acaf99eeb7cfe9501732476f
This patch follows suit, consuming the rehomed code from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Ic3f05914a051b785e0ab2d3542f41aa500074ac0
"}]
commit_message:
use flavors api def from neutron-lib

The flavors extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib with
commit I0229a80bb168bac8dc0fa17fb2b06f1b140d27b4 and will be consumed in
neutron with I265ac1c0596d0fb0acaf99eeb7cfe9501732476f
This patch follows suit, consuming the rehomed code from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Ic3f05914a051b785e0ab2d3542f41aa500074ac0

commit_message:
Use LOCAL2 consistently as default everywhere

The log facility was still set sometimes to LOCAL0 and LOCAL1, let's use
LOCAL2 everywhere for consistency and being able to fix redirects.

Change-Id: Ibaac93743877daef29901a87792ab9beafa1a490

commit_message:
Add jobs for Zuul v3

These are copies of the shade jobs, but they should work with this
stack.

The changes that are not the tests are changes needed to make the tests
work.

[{'created': '2017-11-15 05:37:16.000000000', 'message': 'Install python-openstackclient in kolla-toolbox container

in the past, shade depends on python-ironicclient and
python-ironicclient depends on python-openstackclient. But in the
recent released python-ironiclient 2.0, python-openstackclient is
removed[0]. So python-openstackclient is missing. This will affect all
branches.
Here is a potential issue. we need use upper-constraints.txt
file in kolla-toolbox. install the latest python packages is not a good
idea. Implement this may take much time. Let us fix the gate ASAP and
improve this later.

Change-Id: I55810b641e388e26129b7fa77f97a8736eb1bb48

commit_message:
Install python-openstackclient in kolla-toolbox container

in the past, shade depends on python-ironicclient and
python-ironicclient depends on python-openstackclient. But in the
recent released python-ironiclient 2.0, python-openstackclient is
removed[0]. So python-openstackclient is missing. This will affect all
branches.
Here is a potential issue. we need use upper-constraints.txt
file in kolla-toolbox. install the latest python packages is not a good
idea. Implement this may take much time. Let us fix the gate ASAP and
improve this later.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297730/

Partial-Bug: #1732180
Change-Id: I55810b641e388e26129b7fa77f97a8736eb1bb48
(cherry picked from commit 65cd46e8e6f80aa373680892f6b7e6ec4f55f788)

used in release.

commit_message:
Do not update the container registry if is None

If the variable self.container_registry is None
then it will break, we should handle this error.

This review is related to the LP:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1730687

Change-Id: I9266e0d143c8caa00cb615d35ac808af168b87f2
Closes-Bug: #1730687
(cherry picked from commit cae27828ec1bf81ef63b1f2b6e167c591c0254bb)

commit_message:
Drop module build jobs from our templates

The modules are now built using the job which is defined in
puppet-release-jobs to ensure that the same job content is
used across both environments.

Change-Id: Ib0ef50d4570c4ec12c62faf4656fd19687c3f420

@Sam: I checked the log file [1]. The error message is "cp: cannot stat '/var/log/mariadb': No such file or directory". I don't see how any of the patches could cause this, nor how squashing them would help. Seems to be a problem with Zuul.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/36/519336/3/gate/openstack-chef-repo-integration/a9c6838/job-output.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

> @Sam: I checked the log file [1]. The error message is "cp: cannot
 > stat '/var/log/mariadb': No such file or directory". I don't see
 > how any of the patches could cause this, nor how squashing them
 > would help. Seems to be a problem with Zuul.
 > 
 > [1] http://logs.openstack.org/36/519336/3/gate/openstack-chef-repo-integration/a9c6838/job-output.txt.gz

@Roger Zuul v3 is pretty new. I found the problem, and it's that the external mirror did not respond in enough time:

Err:2 http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu xenial-updates/pike/main amd64 qemu-system-arm amd64 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu3~cloud0
  Cannot initiate the connection to ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com:80 (2001:67c:1360:8c01::23). - connect (101: Network is unreachable) [IP: 2001:67c:1360:8c01::23 80]'}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Right. So, workflow again?'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 12:39:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove domain role from heat service user

This patch semoves the openstack_user resource with :grant_domain
action. A user is always created within a specific domain; such a
mmembership cannot be tacked on later. This resource gave the heat user
the role intended for its project for the domain (i.e., for the Default
domain instead of for the service project).

We add the domain_name attribute that creates the heat user in the
desired domain. Note that this change needs a sufficiently recent
openstackclient cookbook -- otherwise the domain_name attribute is
ignored (which does not matter as long as the heat user is to be created
in the Default domain).

Change-Id: Ifa3d344a3d9094dd1272b126a4dc9ab951c00972
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 13:51:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove domain role from heat service user

This patch removes the openstack_user resource with :grant_domain
action. A user is always created within a specific domain; such a
mmembership cannot be tacked on later. This resource gave the heat user
the role intended for its project for the domain (i.e., for the Default
domain instead of for the service project).

We add the domain_name attribute that creates the heat user in the
desired domain. Note that this change needs a sufficiently recent
openstackclient cookbook -- otherwise the domain_name attribute is
ignored (which does not matter as long as the heat user is to be created
in the Default domain).

Change-Id: Ifa3d344a3d9094dd1272b126a4dc9ab951c00972
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 15:07:38.000000000', 'message': 'Remove domain role from heat service user

This patch removes the openstack_user resource with :grant_domain
action. A user is always created within a specific domain; such a
membership cannot be tacked on later. This resource gave the heat user
the role intended for its project for the domain (i.e., for the Default
domain instead of for the service project).

We add the domain_name attribute that creates the heat user in the
desired domain. Note that this change needs a sufficiently recent
openstackclient cookbook -- otherwise the domain_name attribute is
ignored (which does not matter as long as the heat user is to be created
in the Default domain).

Change-Id: Ifa3d344a3d9094dd1272b126a4dc9ab951c00972
'}]
commit_message:
Remove domain role from heat service user

This patch removes the openstack_user resource with :grant_domain
action. A user is always created within a specific domain; such a
membership cannot be tacked on later. This resource gave the heat user
the role intended for its project for the domain (i.e., for the Default
domain instead of for the service project).

We add the domain_name attribute that creates the heat user in the
desired domain. Note that this change needs a sufficiently recent
openstackclient cookbook -- otherwise the domain_name attribute is
ignored (which does not matter as long as the heat user is to be created
in the Default domain).

Change-Id: Ifa3d344a3d9094dd1272b126a4dc9ab951c00972

commit_message:
Merge shade and os-client-config into the tree

This sucks in the git history for both projects, then moves their files
in place. It should not introduce any behavior changes to any of the
existing openstacksdk code, nor to openstack.config and openstack.cloud
- other than the name change.

TODO(shade) comments have been left indicating places where further
integration work should be done.

It should not be assumed that these are the final places for either to
live. This is just about getting them in-tree so we can work with them.

The enforcer code for reasons surpassing understanding does not work
with python setup.py build_sphinx but it does work with sphinx-build
(what?) For now turn it off. We can turn it back on once the build
sphinx job is migrated to the new PTI.

Change-Id: I9523e4e281285360c61e9e0456a8e07b7ac1243c

commit_message:
Add check-requirements to manila-tempest-plugin

Keep the manila-tempest-plugin project up to date
with changes in requirements versions in openstack

commit_message:
Update tox configuration

Update the tox configuration to pull in the openstack
upper-constraints.txt when running releasenotes. This will
fix the releasenotes job that is currently failing due to
a new version of sphinx. Additionally this change includes
updates from puppet-modulesync-configs.

Change-Id: I51e6bfa3d3a365c74386182d53bf25e7a345f8ed
(cherry picked from commit 0e2460d2e954429468c81fa12ffb85e811f7ca43)

subject: Fix port config in haproxy to avoid conflict
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 17799, 'name': 'Logan V', 'email': 'logan2211@gmail.com', 'username': 'Logan2211'}, {'_account_id': 21883, 'name': 'Manuel Buil', 'email': 'mbuil@suse.com', 'username': 'mbuil'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}, {'_account_id': 24468, 'name': 'Limestone Networks CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@limestonenetworks.com', 'username': 'limestone-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26445, 'name': 'Periyasamy Palanisamy', 'email': 'periyasamy.palanisamy@ericsson.com', 'username': 'pperiyasamy'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21883, 'date': '2017-11-14 14:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2017-11-14 15:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check limestone'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-15 09:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe I am missing something but you have to tell opendaylight to use the new port right? where does that happen?'}, {'account_id': 21883, 'date': '2017-11-15 10:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Maybe I am missing something but you have to tell opendaylight to
 > use the new port right? where does that happen?

No. That is what I tried to briefly explain in the commit message. When using the variable haproxy_backend_port, then haproxy will configure a different port for backend and frontend. So for frontend it uses 8282 but for backend it still uses 8181. I deployed xci using this patch and this is config now:

frontend opendaylight-front-1
    bind 172.29.236.11:8282
    option tcplog
    timeout client 5000s
    acl white_list src 127.0.0.1/8 192.168.0.0/16 172.16.0.0/12 10.0.0.0/8
    tcp-request content accept if white_list
    tcp-request content reject
    mode tcp
    default_backend opendaylight-back


backend opendaylight-back
    mode tcp
    balance leastconn
    timeout server 5000s
    stick store-request src
    stick-table type ip size 256k expire 30m
    option tcplog


    server controller00_neutron_server_container-44a2ff7a 172.29.238.227:8181 check port 8181 inter 12000 rise 1 fall 1

This config is exactly what I want :)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-15 11:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Maybe I am missing something but you have to tell opendaylight to
 > > use the new port right? where does that happen?
 > 
 > No. That is what I tried to briefly explain in the commit message.
 > When using the variable haproxy_backend_port, then haproxy will
 > configure a different port for backend and frontend. So for
 > frontend it uses 8282 but for backend it still uses 8181. I
 > deployed xci using this patch and this is config now:
 > 
 > frontend opendaylight-front-1
 > bind 172.29.236.11:8282

So "something" that was connecting before to "172.29.236.11:8181" is now connecting to "172.29.236.11:8282" correct?
Has that other "something" been adjusted to connect to *:8282 instead?'}, {'account_id': 21883, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > Maybe I am missing something but you have to tell opendaylight
 > to
 > > > use the new port right? where does that happen?
 > >
 > > No. That is what I tried to briefly explain in the commit
 > message.
 > > When using the variable haproxy_backend_port, then haproxy will
 > > configure a different port for backend and frontend. So for
 > > frontend it uses 8282 but for backend it still uses 8181. I
 > > deployed xci using this patch and this is config now:
 > >
 > > frontend opendaylight-front-1
 > > bind 172.29.236.11:8282
 > 
 > So "something" that was connecting before to "172.29.236.11:8181"
 > is now connecting to "172.29.236.11:8282" correct?
 > Has that other "something" been adjusted to connect to *:8282
 > instead?

Right. As far as I know and after rechecking this with Peri (who was the one adding those ports to haproxy ==> https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496583/9/group_vars/haproxy_all/haproxy.yml), the 8181 port is currently not used by anyone. ODL opens its Rest API on both ports and that's why they are added to this config, however we are currently using only 8080 (by neutron). Another solution to the bug could be removing this port... which one would you prefer?'}, {'account_id': 26445, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Manuel, As discussed, let us keep 8181 port under opendaylight haproxy service which would be used by nb services for accessing other MD-SAL data stores. The other one would be used by neutron server only to talk with neutron specific ODL rest webservices.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

OK fine by me. Thank you for the explanation'}, {'account_id': 26445, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:28:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 14:58:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix port config in haproxy to avoid conflict

Opendaylight and repo services are using the same port in the frontend. That
creates connectivity problems. The patch changes the port for opendaylight and
a new variable (haproxy_backend_port) is added so that we can still use the
service running in the old port (8181) relying on haproxy to do a redirection

Change-Id: Ife8c424f26685a6957a9bb7cdccc2ce0523fd3fb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix port config in haproxy to avoid conflict

Opendaylight and repo services are using the same port in the frontend. That
creates connectivity problems. The patch changes the port for opendaylight and
a new variable (haproxy_backend_port) is added so that we can still use the
service running in the old port (8181) relying on haproxy to do a redirection

Change-Id: Ife8c424f26685a6957a9bb7cdccc2ce0523fd3fb

commit_message:
Don't re-propose requirements changes that already exist.

Previously Gerrit would reject changes that were basically duplicates.
So when we submitted a duplicate requirements change it would not get
accepted. The new version of Gerrit now accepts these duplicates which
causes an excessive amount of patches to be posted.

Change the behavior so that know it will only propose a requirements
change when there is an actual change compared to previous proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I89a0477de4317a5cbe76d6ad3a069e49d22df0e2

commit_message:
Enable horizon plugins by default in docker

Horizon's docker image needs explicit configuration for Kolla to
enable its plugins.

This patch only enables the plugins that actually are installed.

Change-Id: I99a20abc3ac4452a3b10167e615957911327cfaa
Closes-bug: #1723929
(cherry picked from commit 7204290f3c33b6c4cba87ae0c8f543954663a5be)

commit_message:
Python2/python3 singlespec version of debtcollector

We need debtcollector for python 3/2 version of oslo.utils
and other oslo libraries.

Change-Id: Ib8173dd57b0dc51dabda2115f50c7a7a678d0d2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-25 14:46:10.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Disruption detection and some stack update roles

So it came up on the rhos-operators open fourm that stack
updates and package updates are supposed to operate without
any service outage.

But asking around not only is there no automated test for this
I also can't find anyone who hand tested it before shipping.

That's a problem, so I desgined this simple script and role
to strobe endpoints during stack update operations.

It's very WIP and may not even be appropriate for this repo
but feedback is appreciated.

Change-Id: Ifbb87ecce2446111c90df5517598473dc6ae828b

"}, {'created': '2017-10-05 19:38:08.000000000', 'message': "Disruption detection and some stack update roles

So it came up on the rhos-operators open fourm that stack
updates and package updates are supposed to operate without
any service outages, but sometimes this isn't the case in prod.

This patch connects to the HAproxy management socket and gets
infromation about all the services behind HA proxy and their
status, if a service enters the down state the disruption detector
script will log that and exit 1.

This should provide some assurance that new changes don't break
HA's consistent uptime even during stack changes. As an easy
way to confirm that this works just try it without an HA environment
it will fail right away.

Change-Id: Ifbb87ecce2446111c90df5517598473dc6ae828b

commit_message:
Disruption detection and some stack update roles

So it came up on the rhos-operators open fourm that stack
updates and package updates are supposed to operate without
any service outages, but sometimes this isn't the case in prod.

This patch connects to the HAproxy management socket and gets
infromation about all the services behind HA proxy and their
status, if a service enters the down state the disruption detector
script will log that and exit 1.

This should provide some assurance that new changes don't break
HA's consistent uptime even during stack changes. As an easy
way to confirm that this works just try it without an HA environment
it will fail right away.

Change-Id: Ifbb87ecce2446111c90df5517598473dc6ae828b

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - resource (3)

This commit migrate all resource policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

This commit also remove policy.json usages completely
from source codes.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I846e88cbd5da0e324834590e739276eead95f615

commit_message:
Require cffi >= 1.7.0

cryptography requires the newer version of cffi, which was released
2016-06. Every user in OpenStack except for oslo.privsep is using
cffi only via cryptography, so that should be fine.

Change-Id: I8e9cfae4d47c7045b333e43e69012e5f6751f48e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 12:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Don't VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC without migrate_disks

If we specify block migration, but there are no disks which actually
require block migration we call libvirt's migrateToURI3() with
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC in flags and an empty migrate_disks in
params. Libvirt interprets this to be the default block migration
behaviour of "block migrate all writeable disks". However,
migrate_disks may only be empty because we filtered attached volumes
out of it, in which case libvirt will block migrate attached volumes.
This is a data corruptor.

This change addresses the issue at the point we call migrateToURI3().
As we never want the default block migration behaviour, we can safely
remove the flag if the list of disks to migrate is empty.

Change-Id: I9b545ca8aa6dd7b41ddea2d333190c9fbed19bc1
Resolves-bug: #1719362
(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)
'}, {'created': '2017-11-14 16:18:55.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Don't VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC without migrate_disks

If we specify block migration, but there are no disks which actually
require block migration we call libvirt's migrateToURI3() with
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC in flags and an empty migrate_disks in
params. Libvirt interprets this to be the default block migration
behaviour of "block migrate all writeable disks". However,
migrate_disks may only be empty because we filtered attached volumes
out of it, in which case libvirt will block migrate attached volumes.
This is a data corruptor.

This change addresses the issue at the point we call migrateToURI3().
As we never want the default block migration behaviour, we can safely
remove the flag if the list of disks to migrate is empty.

(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)

nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py:
  Explicitly asserts byte string destination_xml in
  _test_live_migration_block_migration_flags. Not required in master
  due to change I85cd9a90.

Change-Id: I9b545ca8aa6dd7b41ddea2d333190c9fbed19bc1
Resolves-bug: #1719362
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC without migrate_disks

If we specify block migration, but there are no disks which actually
require block migration we call libvirt's migrateToURI3() with
VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC in flags and an empty migrate_disks in
params. Libvirt interprets this to be the default block migration
behaviour of "block migrate all writeable disks". However,
migrate_disks may only be empty because we filtered attached volumes
out of it, in which case libvirt will block migrate attached volumes.
This is a data corruptor.

This change addresses the issue at the point we call migrateToURI3().
As we never want the default block migration behaviour, we can safely
remove the flag if the list of disks to migrate is empty.

(cherry picked from commit ea9bf5216be60fb3fa1704cf6257adca4e634cb1)

nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py:
  Explicitly asserts byte string destination_xml in
  _test_live_migration_block_migration_flags. Not required in master
  due to change I85cd9a90.

Change-Id: I9b545ca8aa6dd7b41ddea2d333190c9fbed19bc1
Resolves-bug: #1719362

commit_message:
Fix Validations progress

Latest validations results are tracked by execution's updated_at
property but incoming executions from Zaqar message don't have this
set. This patch sets it explicitly until it is fixed in Mistral

Closes-Bug: 1729571
Change-Id: Icb82abd7011fa5b5ac99a7cde26a971282bea409
(cherry picked from commit 0853e0bb6f940368b109d260407b3ae4672d5621)

why is it on the phy in the first place?'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2017-10-31 03:02:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

ok, i see the point of this, it's when you have IPs on your physical interfaces you're putting into a bridge

so i went ahead and tested this ... it doesn't break things


but i'm not convinced this is something we should do

why do these external interfaces have IPs on them in the first place and why should the bridges?  surely they would have a L2 connection to something outside the host?"}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2017-10-31 04:04:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> ok, i see the point of this, it's when you have IPs on your
 > physical interfaces you're putting into a bridge
 > 
 > so i went ahead and tested this ... it doesn't break things

 > 
 > but i'm not convinced this is something we should do
 > 
 > why do these external interfaces have IPs on them in the first
 > place and why should the bridges?  surely they would have a L2
 > connection to something outside the host?

It's for the case that host and guest machines have to share one physical interface for external access, which is normal in many dev environment. If your hosts has well defined enough interfaces, this loop will be skipped."}, {'account_id': 8181, 'date': '2017-11-01 01:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2017-11-01 13:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21307, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21307, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2017-10-25 03:00:30.000000000', 'message': 'openvswitch: Move IP address from physical device to bridge

A physical ethernet device that is part of an Open vSwitch bridge
should not have an IP address. This patch restores the IP address
by moving it to the bridge itself.

Change-Id: I9100a65ecfbb0433a55449178d06879509d01987
'}]
commit_message:
openvswitch: Move IP address from physical device to bridge

A physical ethernet device that is part of an Open vSwitch bridge
should not have an IP address. This patch restores the IP address
by moving it to the bridge itself.

Change-Id: I9100a65ecfbb0433a55449178d06879509d01987

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-29 16:43:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add resize attached volume support

When cinder resizese a volume, it sends an event to nova. This event
calls into the compute driver's "extend_volume" method. Calling the
pypowervm rescan_vstor is all that is needed for our driver.

Only kernel backstores are currently supported by the rescan_vstor
method.

Change-Id: I5197ec2b2d83f221787983c60b62482c417338e9
TODO: Test with at least 1 other cinder driver (not LVM)

When cinder resizes a volume, it sends an event to nova. This event
calls into the compute driver's "extend_volume" method. Calling the
pypowervm rescan_vstor is all that is needed for our driver.

Only kernel backstores are currently supported by the rescan_vstor
method. This patch set only adds support for iSCSI resize.

Not all vios are guaranteed to have the storage mapped. Log an error
if the virtual disk was not found, but throw an error if no virtual
disks were found on any of the vios.

Change-Id: I5197ec2b2d83f221787983c60b62482c417338e9

commit_message:
Add resize attached volume support for iSCSI

Add support for volumes attached with iSCSI to be
extended.
Change-Id: I5197ec2b2d83f221787983c60b62482c417338e9
Depends-on: I0f6f80df6ad0d87dcccc560509c4e31992e4c0ec

commit_message:
ISCSI volume attachment fixes

This change:
 - adds support for multiple volume attachments based on LUN ID
 - handles the new exceptions raised by pypowervm during iSCSI
   discovery (and logout)
 - improves iSCSI attach unit tests
 - add additional parameters to discovery and remove calls
 - add support for multipath
 - add support for RR

Change-Id: If9f3b581bcde57f9ce84b9a2cbe0bb2f9ecaa68c

commit_message:
Add extend volume support for fileio

When cinder resizes a volume, it sends an event to nova. This event
calls into the compute driver's "extend_volume" method. Calling the
pypowervm rescan_vstor is all that is needed for our driver.

Only kernel backstores are currently supported by the rescan_vstor
method.

Not all vios are guaranteed to have the storage mapped. Log an error
if the virtual disk was not found, but throw an error if no virtual
disks were found on any of the vios.

Switching the backstore from USER_QCOW to FILE_IO enables this change.
This adds support to extend size of a volume while it is attached to
a client VM.

Change-Id: I0f6f80df6ad0d87dcccc560509c4e31992e4c0ec

Add a functional vault job

Since we added a vault driver, we should add a functional job
so updates to castellan won't break the vault integration.

commit_message:
Inherited zuulv3 neutron tempest plugin jobs

* In order to test the tempest plugin, this patch adds following
  jobs against neutron repo.
  - neutron-tempest-plugin-api for api tests
  - neutron-tempest-plugin-dvr-multinode-scenario and
    neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge for scenario tests

Change-Id: I85a7508c258bfdf019f599259499d0c85370ba8a

Eduardo Gonzalez wrote:

> please, add a bug id for backport, stable branchs are also affected
>
> Binary images still having openstackclient or only source?

kolla-toolbox is installed from source all the time.
pike is not affected, i think. ( even though i have no idea how the openstack client 
is installed).

anyway, i will file a bug to track this.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-11-14 13:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-11-14 13:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tested just now, pike branch is affected. but still no idea why.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-11-14 13:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-11-14 14:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

found the root cause.

in the past, shade depends on python-ironicclient and python-ironicclient depends on python-openstackclient.

But in the recent released python-ironiclient (2.0), python-openstackclient is removed[0]. So python-openstackclient is missing. This will affect all branches.

Here is a potential issue. we need use upper-constraints.txt file in kolla-toolbox. install the latest python packages is not a good idea. show improve this.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297730/'}, {'account_id': 24043, 'date': '2017-11-14 14:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Install python-openstackclient in kolla-toolbox container

in the past, shade depends on python-ironicclient and
python-ironicclient depends on python-openstackclient. But in the
recent released python-ironiclient 2.0, python-openstackclient is
removed[0]. So python-openstackclient is missing. This will affect all
branches.
Here is a potential issue. we need use upper-constraints.txt
file in kolla-toolbox. install the latest python packages is not a good
idea. Implement this may take much time. Let us fix the gate ASAP and
improve this later.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297730/

Partial-Bug: #1732180
Change-Id: I55810b641e388e26129b7fa77f97a8736eb1bb48

commit_message:
Use mock for HTTP calls in unit tests

In test environment without network access, test_retry_policy_from_var
failed to run as it was not expecting the DNS lookup error. Mocking
the HTTP calls instead helps getting this pass.

Change-Id: I299ecbbc4f3aaafb2044ab32ab3a6bf9d1f9f9b1

This PS update the calico chart and deployment to use
Kubernetes entrypoint, and apply appropriate RBAC rules to
the pods.

subject: Implement retries for git clones
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-15 10:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 10:13:54.000000000', 'message': 'Implement retries for git clones

There have been several failures due to git clone TLS handshake
fails.

This patch implement the use of clone depth in order to reduce
the amount of data being cloned. This will not always work as
depth only works when the clone is from a ref, but it will help
in those circumstances.

This patch also implements retries with a delay between each
retry in order to try and improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I72a7d39218c307fc1c6f108b81f35d2cd5bb5c66
(cherry picked from commit a70706c2f555736327d0ea6514252977c06d78d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Implement retries for git clones

There have been several failures due to git clone TLS handshake
fails.

This patch implement the use of clone depth in order to reduce
the amount of data being cloned. This will not always work as
depth only works when the clone is from a ref, but it will help
in those circumstances.

This patch also implements retries with a delay between each
retry in order to try and improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I72a7d39218c307fc1c6f108b81f35d2cd5bb5c66
(cherry picked from commit a70706c2f555736327d0ea6514252977c06d78d8)

commit_message:
Drop MySQL-python dependency from oslo.db

In order to fade out MySQL-python from OpenStack we need to stop
testing it. Add release notes entry and adjust documentation
references accordingly.

Depends-On: Ie1f07062ed18350bcbb9e7b5e33c7ab2390be9ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 22:42:53.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: libvirt: Fully destroy instances during a hard reboot

Previously the Libvirt driver would only call _destroy and
_undefine_domain when hard rebooting an instance. This would leave
vifs, volumes and any associated encryptors present on the host.

When using encrypted volumes this can lead to failures when the instance
is then recreated, calling down into _get_guest_xml and
_get_guest_storage_config and eventually connect_volume. With the
encryptor attached this call will fail for most backends as the original
path to the volume is now used to present the unencrypted device to the
instance.

Additionally, when using the same encryptors and
resume_state_on_host_boot to restart instances after a host
reboot the skipping of any logic associated with attaching the
encryptors will leave the unencrypted volume attached.

To correct both of these issues _hard_reboot now calls destroy to
disconnect volume and detach encryptors. The reboot parameter is also
dropped from the eventual call to _create_domain_and_network to ensure
these are reconnected and attached prior to the instance being
restarted.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Closes-bug: #1597234
Change-Id: Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986
(cherry picked from commit 94dae1a4ae9453b5198315e620d0ade2b1239dd6)
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: libvirt: Fully destroy instances during a hard reboot

Previously the Libvirt driver would only call _destroy and
_undefine_domain when hard rebooting an instance. This would leave
vifs, volumes and any associated encryptors present on the host.

When using encrypted volumes this can lead to failures when the instance
is then recreated, calling down into _get_guest_xml and
_get_guest_storage_config and eventually connect_volume. With the
encryptor attached this call will fail for most backends as the original
path to the volume is now used to present the unencrypted device to the
instance.

Additionally, when using the same encryptors and
resume_state_on_host_boot to restart instances after a host
reboot the skipping of any logic associated with attaching the
encryptors will leave the unencrypted volume attached.

To correct both of these issues _hard_reboot now calls destroy to
disconnect volume and detach encryptors. The reboot parameter is also
dropped from the eventual call to _create_domain_and_network to ensure
these are reconnected and attached prior to the instance being
restarted.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Closes-bug: #1597234
Change-Id: Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986
(cherry picked from commit 94dae1a4ae9453b5198315e620d0ade2b1239dd6)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.2.12

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I8261aa55435215d94a198830d23e8df04cc7f7d4
Change-Id: Ic652af87e24c60b5c343e496872e78e2b80ddaa7

commit_message:
Checkout from -eol tag if stable branch does not exist

Since cinder and neutron's stable/newton branches have been
end of life'd, we can't install base devstack on stable/newton.

This modifies the git_clone function to check, as a last resort,
if the git_ref is a stable branch and if there is a corresponding
-eol tag, to use that for the checkout rather than the stable branch.

This is needed in the cases that projects are end of life'd out of
order, as is the case with neutron and cinder being end of life before
nova for stable/newton.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Ic2a98ef4933b9b9fc05cd5eb67cc89a86b2e5292
