commit_message:
use l3 api def from neutron-lib

Commit I81748aa0e48b1275df3e1ea41b1d36a117d0097d added the l3 extension
API definition to neutron-lib, commit
I2324a3a02789c798248cab41c278a2d9981d24be rehomed the l3 exceptions and
Ifd79eb1a92853e49bd4ef028e7a7bd89811c6957 shims the l3 exceptions in
neutron.

This patch consumes the l3 API definition from neutron-lib
in prep for If2e66e06b83e15ee2851ea2bc3b64ad366e675dd

Change-Id: Ia63996c641de43472445f6e8ebdb259f89e2b10c

commit_message:
Adjust fixtures .gitignore

The .gitignore influences what files are include in a puppet module
tarball.  Since puppet-horizon has some test files that need to be
included, we need to make sure that we don't completely exclude
spec/fixtures. This change updates the module to just exclude
spec/fixtures/modules which should not be shipped.

Change-Id: Ia363a13f8a2be1f751c32c3a30ad5c4a5d352abf
Closes-Bug: #1732262
(cherry picked from commit 53e8a163d05f8531fad676da7d5dd61b9c651082)

commit_message:
Implement retries for git clones

There have been several failures due to git clone TLS handshake
fails.

This patch implement the use of clone depth in order to reduce
the amount of data being cloned. This will not always work as
depth only works when the clone is from a ref, but it will help
in those circumstances.

This patch also implements retries with a delay between each
retry in order to try and improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I72a7d39218c307fc1c6f108b81f35d2cd5bb5c66
(cherry picked from commit a70706c2f555736327d0ea6514252977c06d78d8)

commit_message:
tripleo-ui: use native nodejs6 jobs and cleanup

- Remove legacy undercloud upgrade job (useless for tripleo-ui)
- use native nodejs6-jobs instead of tripleo legacy.

commit_message:
Add helper property to get the current user id

The data is available, but it's not the MOST straightforward thing to
find. We have helpers for project, add one for user.

messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-13 16:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

FWIW, switching endpoints on the fly seems like an awkward thing to do, and without seeing a valid use case (or having people screaming for it), perhaps just sticking with what you have here is great for now.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:26:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

My intuition on using a context manager here wants everything to reset back to the original auth context after exiting the context manager. I don't see that happening, so I think it makes use of it confusing. It may as well just be a method call."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-13 19:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-14 00:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-14 12:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 15:41:24.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to work in other auth contexts

Add methods and context managers to facilitate working in different
projects or different auth contexts, but sharing the Session and other
config information from the existing cloud. Sharing the Session allows
for version discovery cache to be shared, and keeps the user from
needing to do a bunch of work to get a cloud that's like the current one
but slightly different.

Currently we're only supporting overriding auth information. Is that
enough? Would we want to be able to do
cloud.connect_as(identity_api_version=2)? I think just doing auth gets
us a nice calling API for the common case?

Change-Id: I9190ee725cad00db4e0b6ed8321e3021a703a2e4

commit_message:
Add ability to work in other auth contexts

Add methods and context managers to facilitate working in different
projects or different auth contexts, but sharing the Session and other
config information from the existing cloud. Sharing the Session allows
for version discovery cache to be shared, and keeps the user from
needing to do a bunch of work to get a cloud that's like the current one
but slightly different.

Change-Id: I9190ee725cad00db4e0b6ed8321e3021a703a2e4

Hi Isaku. Thanks for the quick review! 

Yes this is a common problem in other backends (DF, OVN and ODL), with similar solutions to the one proposed here. The main difference with ml2/ovs trunk management is that the trunk port support is handled directly with just the parent port tap through br-int flows, while with ml2/ovs there is actually an intermediate trunk ovs bridge and some patch ports connected to br-int (one per subport). 

In fact, ODL knows about the subport status, and it is actually set to 'ACTIVE' once it is attached to the trunk port. However there are two problems. First, that cause neutron not setting the port to ACTIVE status, is that the subport is not bound to any host, therefore neutron refuses the port transition to ACTIVE. But it actually gets the notification from ODL at the _port_provisioned ml2 plugin. The second problem is that neutron will only receive the notification for the first time the subport is attached to a trunk. Once the subport is attached to the trunk, ODL marks it as ACTIVE and notifies neutron. However, it does not set it back to DOWN upon detach action.

So, in order to fix the issue in a different way, it will not suffice with ODL changing the subports to down (and send the notification) but it would also need to set a host for the subports, similarly to how nova does it for the ports upon VM spawn"}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-08-03 21:34:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-03 21:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-01 07:47:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update subport status for trunk ports

Subports status is not updated when the subport are attached/detached
from the trunk. So, its status remains as DOWN from the neutron
perspective even though it is ACTIVE from the ODL side. The main reason
for this is that, when ODL notifies that the subport status is ACTIVE,
neutron fails to set its status to ACTIVE due to subports not being bound
to any hosts.

This patch ensure that the subport status is modified over time and
aligned with the parent port of the trunk. Therefore, it modifies the
subport status based on:
1. If the subports are attached and the parent port is ACTIVE, the
subports status are set to ACTIVE, otherwise it remains as DOWN.
2. If the subports are detached from the trunk, their status is set to
DOWN.
3. If the parent port status changes (from DOWN to ACTIVE or vice
versa), the subports are updated to copy the parent port status.

Closes-Bug: #1707008
Change-Id: I8a0b034ef2eaaeecdc3ff546620fcc6c96e9bcdc
'}, {'created': '2017-08-01 15:11:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update subport status for trunk ports

Subports status is not updated when the subport are attached/detached
from the trunk. So, its status remains as DOWN from the neutron
perspective even though it is ACTIVE from the ODL side. The main reason
for this is that, when ODL notifies that the subport status is ACTIVE,
neutron fails to set its status to ACTIVE due to subports not being bound
to any hosts.

This patch ensure that the subport status is modified over time and
aligned with the parent port of the trunk. Therefore, it modifies the
subport status based on:
1. If the subports are attached and the parent port is ACTIVE, the
subports status are set to ACTIVE, otherwise it remains as DOWN.
2. If the subports are detached from the trunk, their status is set to
DOWN.
3. If the parent port status changes (from DOWN to ACTIVE or vice
versa), the subports are updated to copy the parent port status.

Closes-Bug: #1707008
Change-Id: I8a0b034ef2eaaeecdc3ff546620fcc6c96e9bcdc
'}]
commit_message:
Update subport status for trunk ports

Subports status is not updated when the subport are attached/detached
from the trunk. So, its status remains as DOWN from the neutron
perspective even though it is ACTIVE from the ODL side. The main reason
for this is that, when ODL notifies that the subport status is ACTIVE,
neutron fails to set its status to ACTIVE due to subports not being bound
to any hosts.

This patch ensure that the subport status is modified over time and
aligned with the parent port of the trunk. Therefore, it modifies the
subport status based on:
1. If the subports are attached and the parent port is ACTIVE, the
subports status are set to ACTIVE, otherwise it remains as DOWN.
2. If the subports are detached from the trunk, their status is set to
DOWN.
3. If the parent port status changes (from DOWN to ACTIVE or vice
versa), the subports are updated to copy the parent port status.

Closes-Bug: #1707008
Change-Id: I8a0b034ef2eaaeecdc3ff546620fcc6c96e9bcdc

commit_message:
use net mtu api writable def from neutron-lib

The net mtu writable extension's API definition was moved into
neutron-lib with commit I3dd29578cee4ac4f9f55f6500965664e9e8069a6
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the parent class of the extension.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: If4b9e0024f3c633bc2ab8db3e7f3237ff349b961

commit_message:
Add ironic image generation and node registration scripts

The image generation script will generate centos xenial and trusty
images along with the deploy image.  It will then upload the images into
glance and clean up after itself, other then the pacakges needed for
diskimage-builder and virtualenv this is all contained and easily
cleaned up.

The node registration script relies on the image generation script being
run first.  It will create flavors if needed, but the values for some of
the variables are designed to be modified (image_ram/cpu for example).

Change-Id: I247cc57f9ec1c961c302eac90be3e5ee2dfa7e2c

Add message to spinner on Deployment Config modal

This patch adds the message "Loading Deployment Configuration..." under
the spinner when the user opens the Deployment Configuration modal.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 12:14:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cinder_backup for horizon dashboard and heat

We specify the "horizon_enable_cinder_backup" and the
"heat_cinder_backups_enabled" settings to be the value of
"cinder_service_backup_program_enabled" if defined. However that
variable is never exposed to the horizon or heat group_vars, so it will
always be undefined, and the feature will never be enabled for heat or
horizon.

We should set these to the variable on localhost, which is how we specify
it for tempest and cinder, since that variable exists as a host_var it
will always exist.

Change-Id: Ibf2a32e03733185fa4bfe9274c65050e12317e6b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder_backup for horizon dashboard and heat

We specify the "horizon_enable_cinder_backup" and the
"heat_cinder_backups_enabled" settings to be the value of
"cinder_service_backup_program_enabled" if defined. However that
variable is never exposed to the horizon or heat group_vars, so it will
always be undefined, and the feature will never be enabled for heat or
horizon.

We should set these to the variable on localhost, which is how we specify
it for tempest and cinder, since that variable exists as a host_var it
will always exist.

Change-Id: Ibf2a32e03733185fa4bfe9274c65050e12317e6b

commit_message:
Move legacy bifrost jobs in-tree

Moving the legacy CI jobs into the bifrost repository so we may have
direct control over the jobs in the repository.

Added additional logic to troubleshoot ocata test failures, and
use the correct tinyipa image for the ocata branch.

Changed the default for inspector to be source based installations
as opposed to package based installations. As a result, with the
defaults present in ocata, the newest version of inspector was
being installed, which would thus fail to execute.

Change-Id: Ic51078addb9282f777689fd769fa3507a29f2990
(cherry picked from commit a81172aa55364f9d060bf9793b5f83eb41f79b7c)
(cherry picked from commit de9604ab50514f47c80e2675e2cf35b00e89635b)

[{'created': '2017-08-23 22:17:45.000000000', 'message': "HAproxy should get full response from ironic-inspector

Ironic-inspector spams the logs with errors if we don't get full
response. If ironic-inspector answers something with 200 it should
be fine.

Change-Id: I464cdd139fb93ce7cd19fc5ac5960f302ae1a9f4
Closes-Bug: #1691971
Resolves: rhbz#1477663
"}]
commit_message:
HAproxy should get full response from ironic-inspector

Ironic-inspector spams the logs with errors if we don't get full
response. If ironic-inspector answers something with 200 it should
be fine.

Change-Id: I464cdd139fb93ce7cd19fc5ac5960f302ae1a9f4
Closes-Bug: #1691971
Resolves: rhbz#1477663

[{'created': '2017-09-05 13:09:25.000000000', 'message': "Increase the value of tempest config 'validation.ping_count' to 3

When OVN is configured as SDN controller, ping count of 1 is not sufficient.
In the case of OVN (wherein it has native L3 support and unlike neutron
reference implementation it doesn't create router namespaces), when the VM
sends the icmp (ping) response, the OVN router pipeline generates an ARP
packet to learn the mac address of the next hop (if it hasn't already
learnt yet, which is always the case for the fist packet) causing the first
ping reply packet to be lost.

Change-Id: I04a568b3e2e21591a4fb5f3733d8b5d85a0a2463

commit_message:
WIP: Increase the value of tempest config 'validation.ping_count' to 3

DEBUGGING TEMPEST FAILURE FOR OVN JOB - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500609/

When OVN is configured as SDN controller, ping count of 1 is not sufficient.
In the case of OVN (wherein it has native L3 support and unlike neutron
reference implementation it doesn't create router namespaces), when the VM
sends the icmp (ping) response, the OVN router pipeline generates an ARP
packet to learn the mac address of the next hop (if it hasn't already
learnt yet, which is always the case for the fist packet) causing the first
ping reply packet to be lost.

Change-Id: I04a568b3e2e21591a4fb5f3733d8b5d85a0a2463

commit_message:
Doc uses alias instead of aliases

The overview_policies doc makes reference to an `alias` option when in
fact the option is `aliases`.
The sample storage policy snippet is correct, it's just incorrect when
listing the possible options.

This change changes the listed option to `aliases`.

Change-Id: Iddf0f19f4d50819ff6abd46e6a1156dc8e4a451d

commit_message:
Add timeout to all requests made via requests lib

Introduce new configu option [DEFAULT]\requests_timeout which is
default to 60 sec. All requests made via requests library will have
timeout set to this option value. This allow to avoid having
stuck session because default request timeout is unlimited
and it is recommended to set it in each request in production [0]

[0] http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/quickstart/#timeouts

Change-Id: I9b9ca7b464e42f0378f019a974fb7246663274de
Closes-Bug: #1730618

[{'created': '2017-11-07 11:59:31.000000000', 'message': 'OPNFV inspired tempest tests of L3 BGPVPN

Following tempest tests were added:
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and network association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and router association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check tenant separation when 2 L3 BGPVPN are created
  and different (but with the same addressation) networks
  are associated to them. Local connectivity has to be kept.
  Separation is checked over HTTP request that resolves
  name of destination server (has to be the same as expexted)

Change-Id: I9e28b5a22c277e973d1d889e734237d18201006d
'}, {'created': '2017-11-08 13:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'Various tempest tests of L3 BGPVPN update

Following OPNFV inspired tempest tests were added:
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and network association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and router association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check tenant separation when 2 L3 BGPVPN are created
  and different (but with the same addressation) networks
  are associated to them. Local connectivity has to be kept.
  Separation is checked over HTTP request that resolves
  name of destination server (has to be the same as expexted)

  import and export RTs servers are not reachable
- negative check that after update of L3 BGPVPN to empty
  RT list servers are not reachable

commit_message:
Various tempest tests of L3 BGPVPN update

Following OPNFV inspired tempest tests were added:
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and network association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check that L3 BGPVPN starts to work when RT is updated
  and router association is added. Local connectivity
  has to be kept
- check tenant separation when 2 L3 BGPVPN are created
  and different (but with the same addressation) networks
  are associated to them. Local connectivity has to be kept.
  Separation is checked over HTTP request that resolves
  name of destination server (has to be the same as expexted)

Additionally, two more update tests were added:
- negative check that after update of L3 BGPVPN to disjoint
  import and export RTs servers are not reachable
- negative check that after update of L3 BGPVPN to empty
  RT list servers are not reachable

Related-Bug: 1731954
Related-Bug: 1732070
Change-Id: I9e28b5a22c277e973d1d889e734237d18201006d

commit_message:
Add defaults for nova metadata settings

In https://review.openstack.org/457040 values were set
without any defaults, causing failures when the role
is executed without the right variables set.

This patch adds defaults and documents the settings in
the defaults file.

Change-Id: Ia2d15bc02fc2fcdfbf0cd8c0b1d41395197168c7
(cherry picked from commit a250a193a865c956c4f5c0e45a539404b227fad1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 12:26:02.000000000', 'message': "Ensure deleted computes aren't counted in stats

Currently if you deploy a compute service to a node
that has previously hosted a compute service that
was subsequently deleted, os_hypervisor_stats will
count the resources from the new and deleted
services due to way the sql join is written in
api.py. This patch ensures that records from both
sides of the join have deleted == 0 when counting
resources.

Change-Id: I8fec143263897c879e1e0fa8e78ffda9ea3d5ccd
Closes-Bug: #1719770
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure deleted computes aren't counted in stats

Currently if you deploy a compute service to a node
that has previously hosted a compute service that
was subsequently deleted, os_hypervisor_stats will
count the resources from the new and deleted
services due to way the sql join is written in
api.py. This patch ensures that records from both
sides of the join have deleted == 0 when counting
resources.

Change-Id: I8fec143263897c879e1e0fa8e78ffda9ea3d5ccd
Closes-Bug: #1719770

subject: Check if bgpvpn enabled in tempest test
messages:
[{'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-10 16:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-10 16:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:39:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-11-13 11:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for taking care of this Cédric.

While having a look at your change, I ended up see this:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/config.py#n642

I hadn't seen this before, and it lead me to read more around this code, to see how it is used.

Then I ended up on this:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/api/network/test_subnetpools_extensions.py#n45


Which leads me to think that perhaps we should introduce another option in tempest.conf, but simply use 

 utils.is_extension_enabled('bgpvpn', 'network')

... in the skip_checks implementation of base.py


What do you think ?"}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-11-13 11:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

My apologies for a bug report which set you on a wrong direction... :-/'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2017-11-13 13:12:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes it's probably the best solution. I will create a new patch.

commit_message:
Check if bgpvpn enabled in tempest test

Tempest plugin currently defines a new 'BGPVPN' service.

This change remove this BGPVPN service and check instead
if the bgpvpn extension is activated to run the tempest tests.

Change-Id: I3731dc52793d4566632c3162d4c79d489b0857f1
Closes-Bug: 1646444

subject: Add session initiation timeout to API calls
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 12:17:41.000000000', 'message': "Add session initiation timeout to API calls

requests library doesn't have default timeout, and according to
documentation it is highly recommended to set this timeout in
production. When no timeout is provided request may hung forever.

This patch adds timeout set to 60 sec to all calls we doing.
This is session initiation timeout, and do not limit entrie
response to download.

Change-Id: I973b9597ccef4880ca6aea72b0f3f20d262273ee
Closes-Bug: #1730618
"}]
commit_message:
Add session initiation timeout to API calls

requests library doesn't have default timeout, and according to
documentation it is highly recommended to set this timeout in
production. When no timeout is provided request may hung forever.

This patch adds timeout set to 60 sec to all calls we doing.
This is session initiation timeout, and do not limit entrie
response to download.

Change-Id: I973b9597ccef4880ca6aea72b0f3f20d262273ee
Closes-Bug: #1730618

Allow to pass list kwargs to image resource type

This can help when you have a lot of images to speed up list operations

(list queries can take over 5 minutes if there are plenty amount of images)

commit_message:
Install ansible-pacemaker during the upgrade/update in the UC

With a Pike undercloud, we might not have ansible-pacemaker
installed on the undercloud.
We need to make sure that ansible-pacemaker is installed for
minor update and later for major upgrade

Closes-Bug: #1732354

Change-Id: I30ed7bcbe4c342a2174f25d62ec85b39ae3317c0

commit_message:
Remove rsync from xinetd when upgrading to containerized deployment

The rsync service needs to be removed from the xinetd service, otherwise
the swift_rsync container will permanently restart because the rsync
port (873) is still in use after upgrading.

Closes-Bug: 1718403
Change-Id: I283919891d00731c96ef963b0c4137d10144ccaf
(cherry picked from commit 7c6e0a43c53c9dfce93ab89c5839198a8460d123)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.12

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I91fd00a333bb9e8abf1e24d3e166ad4ae7eaff48
Change-Id: I1d048e4215fb154ed649f0bdc566338741ad02be

[{'created': '2017-11-14 22:47:02.000000000', 'message': "update description for Change Node Power State

This updates the description of the
'PUT /v1/nodes/{node_ident}/states/power' request to mention that
Bare Metal API version 1.27 was when:
- the 'timeout' parameter was added
- the 'soft power off' and 'soft rebooting' values were made available
  for the 'target' parameter

Change-Id: I1c720a2dd15eab1246ad672b9d7f2b8708ceec0b
"}]
commit_message:
update description for Change Node Power State

This updates the description of the
'PUT /v1/nodes/{node_ident}/states/power' request to mention that
Bare Metal API version 1.27 was when:
- the 'timeout' parameter was added
- the 'soft power off' and 'soft rebooting' values were made available
  for the 'target' parameter

Change-Id: I1c720a2dd15eab1246ad672b9d7f2b8708ceec0b

commit_message:
parallel evaluation fixes

worker call task_done also on failure.
manager to close queues once not needed.

Change-Id: Id5e001a020c91320d4176ccbd67c4a814a3ba6a8

commit_message:
Don't rewrite resource_registry values that aren't paths

If you map to e.g OS::Heat::None, the current code adds an unwanted
path prefix to these entries if the environment triggers this legacy
fallback path (e.g it references files outside of tht_root).

Change-Id: Id591c1a119c3471b599dcaddb363f3d353d25fff
Closes-Bug: #1729039
(cherry picked from commit c5adb1c6551a609d6786853747407f991c2fb274)

subject: elements: Respect devpts mount options
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-09 15:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-11 19:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-13 06:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

my problem with this, and i alluded to it in the other change, is do we really have any idea what we're doing?  I'm starting to think it was a mistake to not bind mount this?

I can find a lot of references to issues such as this, but I can find no solutions that look like this.  a priori, is seems very strange that the permissions  on an existing mount get modified by an additional mount within a chroot? (but, i get the shared nature of this makes it weird).  for example, systemd seems to think that bind mounting is ok as an option when it's setting up namespaces [1].  pbuilder then seems to do something else entirely specifying grp and mode [2].

This, and the prior change, includes no comments on what's a fairly obscure operation in the code ... please at least do that.

[1] https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/master/src/core/namespace.c#L526
[2] https://github.com/mpalmer/pbuilder/blob/master/pbuilder-modules#L246"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-13 07:54:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> my problem with this, and i alluded to it in the other change, is
 > do we really have any idea what we're doing?  I'm starting to think
 > it was a mistake to not bind mount this?
 > 
 > I can find a lot of references to issues such as this, but I can
 > find no solutions that look like this.  a priori, is seems very
 > strange that the permissions  on an existing mount get modified by
 > an additional mount within a chroot? (but, i get the shared nature
 > of this makes it weird).  for example, systemd seems to think that
 > bind mounting is ok as an option when it's setting up namespaces
 > [1].  pbuilder then seems to do something else entirely specifying
 > grp and mode [2].
 > 
 > This, and the prior change, includes no comments on what's a fairly
 > obscure operation in the code ... please at least do that.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/master/src/core/namespace.c#L526
 > [2] https://github.com/mpalmer/pbuilder/blob/master/pbuilder-modules#L246

I am not sure I understand. The previous commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517886/ explained what the problem is. Do you want me to rewrite all that in this one as well?"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-13 08:53:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

no i don't want you to rewrite it but at least comment this magic in the code.

> However, mounting devpts to another location also affects the host's > /dev/pts mountpoint.

that is definitely not an obvious result, nor does it explain the origin of the host permissions, or *why* re-mounting modifies the permissions of an original mount, and why it's obviously more correct to do this than reverting back to a bind mount.  As mentioned I still can't find any project that does something similar setting up their chroots so personally i remain sceptical on the overall correctness of this"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:46:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> no i don't want you to rewrite it but at least comment this magic
 > in the code.

OK

 > 
 > > However, mounting devpts to another location also affects the
 > host's > /dev/pts mountpoint.
 > 
 > that is definitely not an obvious result, nor does it explain the
 > origin of the host permissions, or *why* re-mounting modifies the
 > permissions of an original mount, and why it's obviously more
 > correct to do this than reverting back to a bind mount.  As
 > mentioned I still can't find any project that does something
 > similar setting up their chroots so personally i remain sceptical
 > on the overall correctness of this

I suspect that the reason you are not seeing this 'fix' around is that it's openSUSE specific. Dracut in openSUSE mounts devpts with gid=5.

https://github.com/openSUSE/dracut/blob/e9e5b0424648bc0d81e865d1fe54d10639a10182/modules.d/99base/init.sh#L57

However, if one does 'mount -t devpts ...' then the default options are being used and gid=X is missing from there. That's why a normal 'mount -t devpts' works everywhere but not on openSUSE."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-13 11:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-14 05:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I suspect that the reason you are not seeing this 'fix' around is that it's openSUSE specific. Dracut in openSUSE mounts devpts with gid=5.

I don't think that's correct; my fedora system has it too:

 $ mount | grep pts
 devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,seclabel,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000)

and debian:

 $ mount | grep pts
 devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000)

i'm guessing it must have something to do with systemd as that's about all that is common

I might agree that simply doing "mount -t devpts" (with no other options) is the wrong thing to do.  but are you saying that doing this inside the chroot then affects the mount *outside* the chroot?  it seems like it would be better to understand exactly where those extra options come from, and understanding that, evaluate if it would be a better idea to return to bind mounting it, as we did before.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-14 05:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 07:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > I suspect that the reason you are not seeing this 'fix' around is
 > that it's openSUSE specific. Dracut in openSUSE mounts devpts with
 > gid=5.
 > 
 > I don't think that's correct; my fedora system has it too:
 > 
 > $ mount | grep pts
 > devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,seclabel,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000)
 > 
 > and debian:
 > 
 > $ mount | grep pts
 > devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000)
 > 
 > i'm guessing it must have something to do with systemd as that's
 > about all that is common

But if you do a simple 'mount -t devpts none /dev/pts' when /dev/pts is already mount the gid is lost right? That's the problem I am talking about.

 > 
 > I might agree that simply doing "mount -t devpts" (with no other
 > options) is the wrong thing to do.  but are you saying that doing
 > this inside the chroot then affects the mount *outside* the chroot?
 >  it seems like it would be better to understand exactly where those
 > extra options come from, and understanding that, evaluate if it
 > would be a better idea to return to bind mounting it, as we did
 > before.

We are not doing 'mount -t devpts...' in a chroot. We are mounting devpts in a chroot but we are executing the mount command from the host. And because we omit gid, it's lost.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Actually, I am looking at this kernel commit now

https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=eedf265aa003b4781de24cfed40a655a664457e6

so from what I read it appears that in later kernels you can safely mount /dev/pts in multiple locations.

"Each mount of the devpts filesystem is now distinct such that ptys
+and their indicies allocated in one mount are independent from ptys
+and their indicies in all other mounts."'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Actually, I am looking at this kernel commit now
 > 
 > https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=eedf265aa003b4781de24cfed40a655a664457e6
 > 
 > so from what I read it appears that in later kernels you can safely
 > mount /dev/pts in multiple locations.
 > 
 > "Each mount of the devpts filesystem is now distinct such that ptys
 > +and their indicies allocated in one mount are independent from
 > ptys
 > +and their indicies in all other mounts."

Yeah so this patch may explain things but I haven't parsed it yet

This happens on TW when I mount devpts on another location

# mount -t devpts none /foobar
# mount|grep devpts
devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000)
none on /foobar type devpts (rw,relatime,mode=600,ptmxmode=000)

as you can see the original gid is unaffected in the original /dev/pts mount

but on Leap 42.3 (which doesn't have that patch since it was introduced later on)

# mount -t devpts none /foobar
# mount|grep devpts
devpts on /dev/pts type devpts (rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,mode=600,ptmxmode=000)
none on /foobar type devpts (rw,relatime,mode=600,ptmxmode=000

Does that explain things better?'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2017-11-15 09:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-15 11:02:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

tbh i'm still not 100% sure if this is the right approach over bind mounting.  but i feel like we found the real reason behind what's going on, and at least left useful comments if/when we revisit this"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-15 11:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Btw, thank you for chasing down the details on this'}]

commit_message:
elements: Respect devpts mount options

This is a continuation for f2cc647dae7e ("diskimage_builder: lib:
common-functions: Fix options for devpts mount"). We also need to
respect the devpts mount options when the dib elements are mounting
this virtual filesystems themselves.

Change-Id: Iee44703297a15b14c715f4bfb7bae67f613aceee

commit_message:
Fix ansible running issue on Debian

When deploying on debian, it reports error:
stat /usr/bin/ansible: no such file or directory

That's because on Debian and Ubuntu pip install ansible to
/usr/local/bin/ansible, whereas on CentOS the location is
/usr/bin/ansible.

Change to ansible to handle both cases.

Closes-Bug: #1729216
Depends-On: I2b57403128bc103148ae696c219df52590214adc

Change-Id: I025037cf48596450e6479ab7ff6425c48ac73aad
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>

commit_message:
libvirt: bandwidth param should be set in guest migrate

The bandwidth param set outside of the method "migrate" from guest
object have to be done inside that to avoid duplicating that option.

(cherry picked from commit c212ad27b0a18cf4caf3cf8edb27aaeab310d0e2)

Backported to avoid a minor merge conflict backporting change
I9b545ca8, and because it addresses a related issue calling
migrateToURI3.

Change-Id: I8a37753dea8eca7b26466f17dfbdc184c48c24c5
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refactor Zaqar to satisfy openstack uwsgi goal

After this change, Zaqar-wsgi will not be forced to port 8888 by
devstack. Use apache proxy now and the endpoint will be like:
http://IP/messaging by default.

DOCImpact

Change-Id: Icb6df3111927dd570966f5565e1703d5a4880f5c

commit_message:
Update the services README with the ServiceData parameter

The service README file has been updated to reflect the
recenlty added mandatory service parameter ServiceData.

Change-Id: I276cb61f0d9f84f4b39cdaff63ee67faf0090f72

[{'created': '2017-11-09 10:11:31.000000000', 'message': "Fail on upgrade if legacy ceph::profile::params::osds hiera is found

We should stop the deployment if there is certain stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because if it isn't converted into ceph-ansible variables
the latter could break the deployment using wrong defaults.

Change-Id: Ice2e79a4a3b9a2427b706ec888d6bb8bcca2c542
Related-Bug: #1723085
"}]
commit_message:
Fail on upgrade if legacy ceph::profile::params::osds hiera is found

We should stop the deployment if there is certain stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because if it isn't converted into ceph-ansible variables
the latter could break the deployment using wrong defaults.

Change-Id: Ice2e79a4a3b9a2427b706ec888d6bb8bcca2c542
Related-Bug: #1723085

commit_message:
base: use ceph/jewel on ubuntu

Canonical updated Ceph to Luminous when we want to stay on Jewel for
OpenStack Pike release.

Also hold QEmu on older version as 2.10 is linked with Ceph/Luminous.

Closes-Bug: #1715837

Change-Id: Ia62b51c1601a53095044ceb3070ec33753d9125c

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: IPVPN, fix concurrency issue on import RT update

Remove a non-necessary optimisation to always remove dataplane
state on best_route_removed, to address a concurrency issue
when the list of import route-targets is updated.

We need to add a tempest scenario to test that after an RT update
that removes an RT, connectivity actually stops from happening.

Closes-Bug: 1720802
Depends-On: Ice15324e704048945e4371f4a7eb2e24744fefd7
Change-Id: I06d07f7e23cdead4a1b9481b6b816511d220f1ea

[{'created': '2017-11-02 14:34:49.000000000', 'message': 'Stop registering "graphs" resource to quota

As it's a POST-only special purpose resource, quota doesn't
make much sense.  Even worse, it prevents the new quota_details
extension from working if lbaas is configured.

Closes-Bug: #1715594
Change-Id: I9bc85c9bab1fba1ae54259cde6f34f6b8d43b4a9
(cherry picked from commit 0c93199f18ac4e10ba76ff22fd07cd76c4280334)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop registering "graphs" resource to quota

As it's a POST-only special purpose resource, quota doesn't
make much sense.  Even worse, it prevents the new quota_details
extension from working if lbaas is configured.

Closes-Bug: #1715594
Change-Id: I9bc85c9bab1fba1ae54259cde6f34f6b8d43b4a9
(cherry picked from commit 0c93199f18ac4e10ba76ff22fd07cd76c4280334)

commit_message:
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION Wrongly Templated As String

In the template file horizon_local_settings.py.j2, the
IMAGES_ALLOW_LOCATION value is being set as a string, when it should
be a bool.

Change-Id: I6589fe93abab76243d30136babaa7b1e95989243
Closes-Bug: 1727438
(cherry picked from commit 941398b22cb2f5be9eaa4131e876b10921b8e5b2)

commit_message:
Fix gnocchiclient creation

Gnocchiclient uses keystoneauth1.adapter so that adapter_options
need to be given.
This patch fixes gnocchiclient creation.

Change-Id: I6b5d8ee775929f4b3fd30be3321b378d19085547
Closes-Bug: #1714871
(cherry picked from commit a2fa13c8ff71a11d9b13bb06e932754cc2a5e4ef)

Do I understand it correctly that this code does not use the new node_group_template_import method in saharaclient but the good old node_group_template_create?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-11-14 15:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

Luigi, there is no such method in Saharaclient anyway. the "import" operation is not build upon such new APIs etc. Only "export" stuff depends on new client/API stuff.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-14 16:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Ack, thanks, I totally forgot how it was supposed to work.

Then it should work nicely also with older saharaclient versions, no special magic to ensure compatibility.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-15 10:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow+1'}]

Add import of node group templates

Partially-Implements: bp portable-node-group-and-cluster-templates

This change adds Import Template button to Node Group Templates Tab.

commit_message:
Do not configure kvm virt_type in devstack

Disable the configuration of the kvm virt_type in devstack
as some of the nodes in infra are exhibiting a bug [1] and
failing the gate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-lts-xenial/+bug/1682077

Change-Id: I4a59914cd14a9b88bad91adb09fd4235cb923907

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 17:07:37.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup Sahara tags

In 504e8ecb66f113ab2a694fda89ae469eb899dc8f we split up each Sahara
component into its own deliverable. As a temporary measure, each
component received all the tags from the former single deliverable.

Removal of tags is motivated as follows:
* assert:follows-standard-deprecation and assert-supports-upgrade should
  only be applied to services
* tc:approved-release is generally only applied to the main
  repo/deliverable of a project

Also, for consistency with other projects, docs entry is removed for all
but the main Sahara service (even though those central docs do somewhat
deal with the other components).

Change-Id: I654b09cdf6872196bb691cafb525d2bda4b152c1
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup Sahara tags

In 504e8ecb66f113ab2a694fda89ae469eb899dc8f we split up each Sahara
component into its own deliverable. As a temporary measure, each
component received all the tags from the former single deliverable.

Removal of tags is motivated as follows:
* assert:follows-standard-deprecation and assert-supports-upgrade should
  only be applied to services
* tc:approved-release is generally only applied to the main
  repo/deliverable of a project

Also, for consistency with other projects, docs entry is removed for all
but the main Sahara service (even though those central docs do somewhat
deal with the other components).

Change-Id: I654b09cdf6872196bb691cafb525d2bda4b152c1

fulfill Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate

and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-10 10:43:09.000000000', 'message': 'Implement retries for git clones

There have been several failures due to git clone TLS handshake
fails.

This patch implement the use of clone depth in order to reduce
the amount of data being cloned. This will not always work as
depth only works when the clone is from a ref, but it will help
in those circumstances.

This patch also implements retries with a delay between each
retry in order to try and improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I72a7d39218c307fc1c6f108b81f35d2cd5bb5c66
'}]
commit_message:
Implement retries for git clones

There have been several failures due to git clone TLS handshake
fails.

This patch implement the use of clone depth in order to reduce
the amount of data being cloned. This will not always work as
depth only works when the clone is from a ref, but it will help
in those circumstances.

This patch also implements retries with a delay between each
retry in order to try and improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I72a7d39218c307fc1c6f108b81f35d2cd5bb5c66

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: Icf24592d16e002960d0a248d8666e77dc5683dd7
Closes-Bug: #1565928

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-heat-docs-ubuntu-xenial/cbfb128//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 5m 02s

- gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-amqp1-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-amqp1-ubuntu-xenial-nv/e571c0b/ : SUCCESS in 1h 09m 29s (non-voting)
- gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-non-apache-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-non-apache-ubuntu-xenial/93c7c17/ : SUCCESS in 1h 14m 14s
- gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-py35-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-py35-ubuntu-xenial/19eee2c/ : SUCCESS in 57m 06s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-heat-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-heat-ubuntu-xenial/91a453c/ : SUCCESS in 40m 45s
- gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/60/509760/1/check/gate-heat-dsvm-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/7e17a22/ : SUCCESS in 1h 10m 16s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-10-07 00:29:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I'm not convinced we can't just include it in the output unconditionally... if clients aren't looking for it then it's unlikely to hurt them.

Even if we don't agree with that, I think we should probably still include it unconditionally in the RPC API output and handle the flag purely within heat-api."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-10-09 11:59:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

If we include it by default in the RPC response, old APIs would always return the data, so it somewhat defeats the purpose (not break compatibility).

That said, maybe including it by default isn't too bad. I feel that's where micro versions would be useful, but we don't have them. It's certainly simpler to just put the data in there."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-09 12:55:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Happy to go with the consensus re the RPC payload - if that's that we just include it by default then I'll adjust the patch to do that - from earlier discussions with therve it seemed like maybe this approach might be preferred but I don't have any strong opinion on it."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-10-09 14:25:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If we include it by default in the RPC response, old APIs would always return the data, so it somewhat defeats the purpose (not break compatibility).

Good point. Although it would be a very temporary issue, during upgrades of the Heat service.

I'd still be OK with just always including it from now on, unless somebody objects. (BTW please add a release note to this patch :) We could check e.g. the Horizon code, but it's hard to imagine this breaking clients."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-09 14:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok so to clarify, unconditionally add to the RPC response, but do we also want it unconditionally added to the API response, or only via the new flag?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-31 11:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-31 13:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-31 16:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-10-31 17:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This looks good to me. Could you also update the API documentation in api-ref/source/v1/stack-templates.inc and the example in api-ref/source/v1/samples/template-validate-response.json and maybe consider documenting how users can validate the environment merging in doc/source/template_guide/environment.rst too?'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-03 16:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Tests still need fixing, but otherwise looks good.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-08 03:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the feedback, will rebase and address the comments soon'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-13 12:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2017-11-13 13:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

Several test failures commented inline. Also failures in:

* heat_integrationtests.functional.test_unicode_template.StackUnicodeTemplateTest.test_template_validate_override_default
* heat_integrationtests.functional.test_unicode_template.StackUnicodeTemplateTest.test_template_validate_basic'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

See comments on patch set 5, there are several other test failures to resolve.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-14 09:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks for the comments Zane, I think I addressed all the issues'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:18:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

Ugh more errors, fixing'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-14 16:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-14 19:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Thanks! LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-15 08:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Return Environment from validate_template

This is to enable preview of the merged environment
without merging the environment on the client side.

Related-Bug: #1635409
Change-Id: I7ec3af729a65164230153021f438bf226cc5e858

messages:
[{'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2017-11-02 14:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2017-11-02 18:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-11-10 15:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for catching this.
Do you think we could declare `engine` as the global variable and initialize it on the module level in `sql_repository` instead of constructor? Should be cleaner, I guess, and not require the tear_down stuff.'}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2017-11-13 14:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Witold,
I agree a global variable is better. But I could not understand where you mean to declare it?
if in sql_repository then it would need tead_down yet. 

 > Thanks for catching this.
 > Do you think we could declare `engine` as the global variable and
 > initialize it on the module level in `sql_repository` instead of
 > constructor? Should be cleaner, I guess, and not require the
 > tear_down stuff.

 > Thanks for catching this.
 > Do you think we could declare `engine` as the global variable and
 > initialize it on the module level in `sql_repository` instead of
 > constructor? Should be cleaner, I guess, and not require the
 > tear_down stuff.

 > Thanks for catching this.
 > Do you think we could declare `engine` as the global variable and
 > initialize it on the module level in `sql_repository` instead of
 > constructor? Should be cleaner, I guess, and not require the
 > tear_down stuff.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Amir, you're right. We do need tear_down."}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2017-11-13 17:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, do you think yet that global variable is better?

 > Amir, you're right. We do need tear_down."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yes, I think it's better to use global variable but it will require some refactoring of tests. I leave it up to you. If no new code appears I merge tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-11-15 08:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-15 07:28:05.000000000', 'message': 'Set strategy: free for build-wheel-mirror jobs

While we are using multi-node jobs, neither host needs to talk to the
other. So, have the race fast as possible to the end of their

Change-Id: I6fa39a5444d1c3e6188e1067ffaa45d0fe97e90d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set strategy: free for build-wheel-mirror jobs

While we are using multi-node jobs, neither host needs to talk to the
other. So, have the race fast as possible to the end of their
playbooks.

Change-Id: I6fa39a5444d1c3e6188e1067ffaa45d0fe97e90d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 12:06:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add no-vendor interface to the idrac hardware types

Vendor interfaces must not be mandatory. Missing no-vendor implementation
means that we require operators to enable the idrac vendor interface when
the idrac hardware type is enabled.

Change-Id: I6768a37bc268e367eaf93b12660a80d31eeca0c0
Closes-Bug: #1732166
'}]
commit_message:
Add no-vendor interface to the idrac hardware types

Vendor interfaces must not be mandatory. Missing no-vendor implementation
means that we require operators to enable the idrac vendor interface when
the idrac hardware type is enabled.

Change-Id: I6768a37bc268e367eaf93b12660a80d31eeca0c0
Closes-Bug: #1732166

commit_message:
Remove wheel-mirror semaphore

These jobs no longer need to be run one at a time. Because we now
support DAG jobs we now release one all have been successful.

Change-Id: I11b508be98c43503948649ef64f32cfb30a56305
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix logging of password during create_vim.

create_vim function logged the vim_arg object which includes an
embedded password.  This change masks that password.

Change-Id: I80432ab3432a8a1eea8f1f9c74c0deb5ce0180d1

commit_message:
Allow networking-odl to support DSCP Marking rule for qos driver

Updated rules for DSCP Marking rule to enable them. There are
patches for the same in the opendaylight.

https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/q/topic:qos

Change-Id: Ieed8947b92ee4b0afc7c86903a27fa8fa84f24bc
closes-Bug: #1686625
depends-on: I74a3041cd38fdf8d0e17f35fce223393e198b563

Thanks for working on this!

Do you think we could remove the option?

Neutron knows about bindings between ports and hosts.  We could check the host to see if has a bridge mapping configured for the network the floating IP is on.  Based on the result, we can set up the NAT configuration in OVN to be local to the compute node or at the central SNAT gateway.  Would something like this work?

Or do you think there's a case where bridge mappings may be defined, but someone still wants all floating IPs to be on the SNAT gateway node?"}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-05-31 02:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-05-31 10:56:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think it's good to have functional tests in this patch, rather than adding it later."}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-05-31 10:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24438, 'date': '2017-06-01 10:35:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Neutron knows about bindings between ports and hosts.  We could check the host to see if has a bridge mapping configured for the network the floating IP is on.  Based on the result, we can set up the NAT configuration in OVN to be local to the compute node or at the central SNAT gateway.  Would something like this work?

If some of the chassis configuration bridge mapping, and some are not configured, how do?
Have OVN check this mapping?  If there is no mapping, traffic will be directed to the centralized gateway?


>
> Or do you think there's a case where bridge mappings may be defined, but someone still wants all floating IPs to be on the SNAT gateway node?
It may be better to use physical network and bridge mapping control in each chassis."}, {'account_id': 24438, 'date': '2017-06-01 10:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-01 10:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
support distributed floating ip

User can enable the distributed floating ip by configuring the
option enable_distributed_floating_ip.

This require the user to configure the physical network map
to connecting the floating ip's network on each compute node.

the Nat action for floating IP will be done locally, not
gateway. This will saves the path to the external network.

Change-Id: I4e8d6811b5a544e68b184fe457391b35e4516d01
Co-authored-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-22 02:56:41.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the way to serach file 'glance-api-paste.ini'

With the original method _get_deployment_config_file() in config.py,
if the option config_file is specified in glance-api.conf, and run
command 'glance-api' in any derectory except /etc/glance, the
the method load_paste_app() will throw an IOError, but the
IOError not be catched. The same error will happen with
'glance-registery'.

The reason for this IOError is the code "os.path.abspath(path)" in
_get_deployment_config_file()  will returns a file glance-api-paste.ini
with absolute path '${cur_dir}/glance-api-paste.ini'. The {cur_dir}
represent the current direcotry which run 'glance-api'

This pacth modified several lines of code in methods
_get_paste_config_path() and  _get_deployment_config_file() to avoid
the IOError.Also, this patch will optimize the exception log in
 _get_deployment_config_file() in order to tell users which file is
 not find.

Change-Id: I970c1acb073700b15e153dd08c9ec14d20f0e83d
Closes-Bug: 1712226

_get_deployment_config_file()  will return a value

not exist under {cur_dir}.Such as running the command under /opt, but
the 'glance-api-paste.ini' dose not exist under /opt.

This pacth modified one line of code in methods _get_paste_config_path()
for solving the IOError. At the same time, this patch adds one test case.

commit_message:
Optimize the way to serach file 'glance-api-paste.ini'

With the original method _get_deployment_config_file() in config.py,
if the option config_file is specified in glance-api.conf, and run
command 'glance-api' under a directory, the the method load_paste_app()
will throw an IOError, but the IOError dose not been catched. The same
error will happen with'glance-registery'.

The reason for this IOError is the code "os.path.abspath(path)" in
_get_deployment_config_file()  will return a value
'{cur_dir}/glance-api-paste.ini', but the 'glance-api-paste.ini' does
not exist under {cur_dir}.Such as running the command under /opt, but
the 'glance-api-paste.ini' dose not exist under /opt.

This pacth modifies one line of code in method _get_paste_config_path()
for solving the IOError. At the same time, it provides one test case.

Change-Id: I970c1acb073700b15e153dd08c9ec14d20f0e83d
Closes-Bug: 1712226

The current message logged when showing image locations or direct_url
is enabled makes it sound like there's a problem with the storage
backend, whereas it's really just an explanation of why the locations
or direct_url are empty/missing in the image response.  This patch

commit_message:
Clarify log message

The current message logged when showing image locations or direct_url
is enabled makes it sound like there's a problem with the storage
backend, whereas it's really just an explanation of why the locations
or direct_url are empty/missing in the image response.  This patch
rewrites the message to say that explicitly.

Change-Id: I9768fbba73aa290a7d159c01bd5ac0e9237f48ed
Closes-bug: #1728689

That's not how this works.  numpy was pulled in by $something can you can't just remove it.  We can alter the value if there is an issue with the value selected."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-13 14:31:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

well that's my argument. this has never existed in g-r. it seems it was just part of initial auto-gen of requirements project. i plan on removing this from all branches/master but i started here becasue it's breaking us.

pandas and numpy are essentially mutual libs. pandas is currently not part of g-r so it's allowed to run unchecked. i can't see a reason for having a lib in u-c but not in g-r... and since it's never been added to g-r since the dawn of 'requirements',  i imagine no one wants numpy added."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-13 18:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-14 14:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 22752, 'date': '2017-11-15 07:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm curious about the reason why a requirement exists in u-r but not in g-r. I'm not clear if this requirement should be added in g-r or removed in g-r. So this need some clear explanations."}]

remove numpy from upper-constraints

it's not in global requirements and the current level breaks its
relationship to pandas which is also not in global-requirements

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 22:28:09.000000000', 'message': "Use PCRE instead of Python's re for RedirectMatch tests

Previously, RedirectMatch rules were evaluated using Python's re regexp
module. However, Apache httpd uses the PCRE library for evaluating
regular expressions,[1] and there are subtle differences between the
Python and PCRE implementations. Using the PCRE library itself (via the
pcre-python binding) provides more representative results, and hence
more confidence to the user that any rules that pass whereto's tests
will work in the same way in a real Apache configuration.

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/trunk/glossary.html#regex

Change-Id: Ibef3376d9da0688d0c97f5837dacc5b7cc52431c
"}, {'created': '2017-11-09 14:59:48.000000000', 'message': "Use PCRE instead of Python's re for RedirectMatch tests

Previously, RedirectMatch rules were evaluated using Python's re regexp
module. However, Apache httpd uses the PCRE library for evaluating
regular expressions,[1] and there are subtle differences between the
Python and PCRE implementations. Using the PCRE library itself (via the
pcre-python binding) provides more representative results, and hence
more confidence to the user that any rules that pass whereto's tests
will work in the same way in a real Apache configuration.

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/trunk/glossary.html#regex

Change-Id: Ibef3376d9da0688d0c97f5837dacc5b7cc52431c
"}]
commit_message:
Use PCRE instead of Python's re for RedirectMatch tests

Previously, RedirectMatch rules were evaluated using Python's re regexp
module. However, Apache httpd uses the PCRE library for evaluating
regular expressions,[1] and there are subtle differences between the
Python and PCRE implementations. Using the PCRE library itself (via the
pcre-python binding) provides more representative results, and hence
more confidence to the user that any rules that pass whereto's tests
will work in the same way in a real Apache configuration.

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/trunk/glossary.html#regex

Change-Id: Ibef3376d9da0688d0c97f5837dacc5b7cc52431c

subject: Detect group matches in replacements more robustly
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-08 22:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-10 18:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nWhat an embarrassing bug you've found. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-15 07:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 22:28:09.000000000', 'message': "Detect group matches in replacements more robustly

The Python re module uses '\n' for group backreference substitution,
whereas mod_alias uses '$n', and thus we must translate between them
when processing RedirectMatch directives. Previously this was done by
substituting backslashes for any dollar signs in the replacement string.
However, group substitution only occurs when the $ is not escaped with a
backslash and is followed by a decimal digit. Follow the same rules
here.

Change-Id: Ib33534b40e0b126c769ec17f76e1ecc83d790ebc
"}]
commit_message:
Detect group matches in replacements more robustly

The Python re module uses '\n' for group backreference substitution,
whereas mod_alias uses '$n', and thus we must translate between them
when processing RedirectMatch directives. Previously this was done by
substituting backslashes for any dollar signs in the replacement string.
However, group substitution only occurs when the $ is not escaped with a
backslash and is followed by a decimal digit. Follow the same rules
here.

Change-Id: Ib33534b40e0b126c769ec17f76e1ecc83d790ebc

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-17 15:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Tung, thanks for the quick reply and sharing your thoughts. So couple things here, 
1. Having tosca.policies.Monitoring makes sense, but as you know, unfortunately you or I can’t introduce it as normative type. It has to be done in the TOSCA spec. Which as far as I know or as I checked latest draft is not the case. So until that happen I guess we have to treat it as custom type. If someone from Tacker team bring this forward (as Tacker have a real use case) to Shitao or someone in TC that would be good. I will also try to bring it to TC. 
2. The problem I noticed is that the tosca.policies.Monitoring as it’s currently used in Tacker def file is broken/invalid. All policies must eventually derived from  tosca.policies.Root but the seems like tosca.policies.Monitoring has no parent in definition. Ideally, if I understood correctly, the tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring should derive from tosca.policies.Monitoring (once it become a normative node in TOSCA spec) or for now tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring seems valid custom type as at least it does derive from Root. 

Hope makes sense. I sure missed meeting you in the Barcelona :('}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2017-01-17 16:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Hi Tung, thanks for the quick reply and sharing your thoughts. So
 > couple things here,
 > 1. Having tosca.policies.Monitoring makes sense, but as you know,
 > unfortunately you or I can’t introduce it as normative type. It has
 > to be done in the TOSCA spec. Which as far as I know or as I
 > checked latest draft is not the case. So until that happen I guess
 > we have to treat it as custom type. If someone from Tacker team
 > bring this forward (as Tacker have a real use case) to Shitao or
 > someone in TC that would be good. I will also try to bring it to
 > TC.
 > 2. The problem I noticed is that the tosca.policies.Monitoring as
 > it’s currently used in Tacker def file is broken/invalid. All
 > policies must eventually derived from  tosca.policies.Root but the
 > seems like tosca.policies.Monitoring has no parent in definition.
 > Ideally, if I understood correctly, the tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring
 > should derive from tosca.policies.Monitoring (once it become a
 > normative node in TOSCA spec) or for now tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring
 > seems valid custom type as at least it does derive from Root.
 > 
 > Hope makes sense. I sure missed meeting you in the Barcelona :(

Hi Sahdev, thanks for clarifying.
I created those changes in Tacker. The purpose is to hope to have tosca.policies.Monitoring in the future. At that time I referred to this doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1opZu-dJT6ANS-NKrmeyIOHm5sbTom03TqtfV7gWOYb0/edit?ts=5793ad13
But now it seems not to be ready. I will move forward when having consensus on this. Hope Sridhar and other Tacker cores could review this patch too.

I looked for you at Summit but missed meeting you too :)'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-17 17:43:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Tung, yrw! The doc is impressive and I see that it did assume Monitoring policy as normative type in TOSCA Simple profile. Yes, I agree with the approach of waiting on other reviewers and see what they find out. If Monitoring is not a normative type (which I don't see it is) then I guess the changes in this patch seems OK or if I am missing anything and Monitoring is available as normative one (which I don't see in spec, but just in case) then I guess the 'tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring' should derive from 'tosca.policies.Monitoring' (base type) similar to other policies/node etc. Thanks Tung!"}, {'account_id': 13380, 'date': '2017-01-17 22:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@tung - can you please create follow on patchset to this to add a auto-scale functional test that uses selective VDU targets?'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-18 02:33:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@Tung, unfortunately I got some viral infection on Thursday of summit so I couldn't able to come to Tacker sessions on Friday :( .. let's hope to meet in the next one!!"}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-18 02:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Tung, so if treating tosca.policies.Monitoring as a normative type in the tosca-parser and heat-translator helps Tacker then I am fine with it and please go ahead with making changes in t-p and h-t as you mentioned earlier. (btw, I am out on work travel from 19 to 24 but I will review changes soon I can) As Sridhar mentioned if it eventually becomes part of spec as normative than it's OK to have it implemented earlier. Please let me know if you run into any question with t-p or h-t. Bharth and Bob are good references for both projects as well. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-18 23:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Bob and Bharath, I will be out on business travel from later tomorrow to Jan 24th. Please review and merge any changes that Tung updates into tosca-parser and or heat-translator to speed up work as needed. @Tung, if you upload any patch for t-p or h-t please let Bob and Bharath know. Thanks!!'}, {'account_id': 16511, 'date': '2017-01-19 00:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2017-01-19 00:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi sahdev,
Unfortunately, I am on vacation for Lunar New year until the end of next week. But will try to create some patches in TP and HT in next several days. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 13380, 'date': '2017-01-20 23:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Bharath / Kanagaraj - please review this when you get a chance, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 10487, 'date': '2017-01-23 04:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

should this to be derived from root policy ?'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2017-01-26 20:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Kanagaraj, the alarming was already derived from "tosca.policies.Monitoring". With these changes the parent of it tosca.policies.tacker.Monitoring is deriving from tosca.policies.root. Since Alarming is tightly associated with monitoring, the additional props of tosca.policies.Monitoring may come useful in future. If we want to detach Alarming from Monitoring that's fine with me, but these just my two cents. I will go with what you and Tacker team decide. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 13380, 'date': '2017-01-27 00:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Temporarily use root node type until monitoring node is supported

The tosca.policies.Monitoring seems an invalid node as it doesn't have it's
own definition and it doesn't derive from any normative type.

Co-Authored-By: yong sheng gong <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: sahdev zala <spzala@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Id6fa299531abe5c310fe59d9915e8c361e7bd599
Closes-Bug: #1656997

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Keystone secret for k8s 1.8

This PS updates the keystone secret in Gnocci to be compatible with
Kubernetes 1.8 which has stricter requirements for secret
definitions.

Change-Id: Ie5799bdb531fab02ba0c817bdd9d692f3cedd0a9

subject: Update .gitignore for JetBrains(PyCharm) users
messages:
[{'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-14 06:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-14 07:07:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Discussions on Editor-specific gitignore entries happens repeatedly, but the general direction is we don't have editor-specific in .gitignore in project repositories. (note that some projects have such but we don't encourage to clean them up and add such to other repos.)

gitignore_global is the more suggested way to have personal gitignore entries."}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-14 07:16:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Discussions on Editor-specific gitignore entries happens
 > repeatedly, but the general direction is we don't have
 > editor-specific in .gitignore in project repositories. (note that
 > some projects have such but we don't encourage to clean them up and
 > add such to other repos.)
 > 
 > gitignore_global is the more suggested way to have personal
 > gitignore entries.

Yes. But Horizon supported for this [1]. Is this possible for its sub-project?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/commit/ee16100db91e1fab2203268c2f5c0d0367d5737d"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:57:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the horizon commit was accidental. this is a separate project from horizon. We don't need to introduce more chaos situation.

Perhaps this is the most recent discussion on the dev ML
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/thread.html#106252

I keep my -1 as I believe this is right. If other reviewers agree to add it, I can just remove my -1."}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-15 01:54:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After looking at the thread you pointed out. I don't see any consensus about what need to do with it. Each project have different degrees of strictness on their .gitignore file. Also when checking some current OpenStack projects, I see there a lot of project accepted for this [1]. So, I don't see the strong reason at the moment. Let me get more though from others and then I can just abandon it if other don't agree.

Note: I am using gitignore_global but it happened when I used new env with forgot the config. That lead to this change.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/626310/"}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-15 01:56:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Added Ying Zuo (Horizon PTL) and Yamamoto to get their though. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-15 04:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If it is limited to neutron-vpnaas-dashboard, I am okay to some extent. However, if you try to spread out the same things to many repos, it is completely unnecessary and annoying. There seems no strong consensus but there is no consensus we can have it in various repos. If you are a new contributor, I am fine to approve it because it is helpful be familiar with the development process, but this is not the case for you.'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-15 04:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> However, if you try to spread out the same things to many
 > repos, it is completely unnecessary and annoying.

As commented above, I am not trying to spread out the same thing. Because this is only change i made for the project that i am actively working on. And I think it is a little bit helpful.

 > If you are a new contributor, I am fine to approve
 > it because it is helpful be familiar with the development process,
 > but this is not the case for you.

Yes. You are right. This is my intention for new contributors (not me).

So, I am going to abandon this. And guide new contributors how to avoid such thing in the review in case they encounter the problem later.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2017-11-15 05:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

i don't have strong opinions either ways. but akihiro's suggestion to use .gitignore_global sounds reasonable."}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-15 06:00:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > i don't have strong opinions either ways. but akihiro's suggestion
 > to use .gitignore_global sounds reasonable.

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-15 06:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
